0.title: US can't independently confirm atrocities in Ukraine: Official
0.article_body: A senior US defence official on Monday said that the Pentagon is not in a position to independently confirm Ukrainian accounts of atrocities by Russian forces against civilians in the town of Bucha. "But we're also not in any position to refute those claims," he added. Russia has denied allegations of an alleged massacre in Bucha.

1.title: Nortje returns to training ahead of DC vs LSG, DC share pic
1.article_body: Ahead of DC-LSG clash in IPL 2022, DC posted a picture of pacer Anrich Nortje on Twitter practising in nets on Monday and wrote, "Nortje. Training. That's it. That's the post." Nortje hasn't played since T20I World Cup 2021 due to hip and back injuries. He has to get clearance from Cricket South Africa before making it to playing XI.

2.title: I'm very much alive: Rijiju after NCP leader Sule's slip of tongue
2.article_body: After NCP leader Supriya Sule, in a slip of tongue, said Kiren Rijiju was no more, the Union Minister tweeted, "I am very much alive." While appreciating Rijiju's role as the Sports Minister, Sule said he is no more, which she immediately corrected by saying he is no more the minister. Rijiju had also tweeted a clip of the incident.

3.title: Who were the top corporate donors to national parties in 2019-20 as per ADR?
3.article_body: Prudent Electoral Trust was the top donor to two national parties - BJP and INC - in FY 2019-20, according to a report by NGO ADR on Monday. The Trust donated 38 times in a single year to the two parties each, amounting to a total of ₹247.75 crore. Janakalyan Electoral Trust was the second-largest corporate donor, followed by ITC.

4.title: I cried for 40 minutes: World no. 1 Iga Swiatek on Ash Barty's retirement
4.article_body: Iga Swiatek, who became the world number one women's tennis player on Monday, revealed she cried for 40 minutes after she came to know that Ash Barty retired aged 25. "I didn't know it was going to happen...I always had this vision...we'd all play until we're 35 or something until our bodies are...tired that we can't anymore," she added.

5.title: Investors get ₹4.5 lakh crore richer as Sensex rallies over HDFC merger
5.article_body: Investors turned richer by over ₹4.5 lakh crore on Monday as Sensex ended 1,335 points higher at 60,612, primarily led by the merger announcement of HDFC and HDFC Bank. Data showed that investor wealth, measured by the combined market capitalisation of BSE-listed companies, rose to around ₹272.46 lakh crore. Investors of HDFC group companies gained over 1 lakh crore.

6.title: BJP received highest corporate donations of ₹720 crore in 2019-20: ADR
6.article_body: BJP received the maximum corporate donations of ₹720.407 crore from 2,025 corporate donors in 2019-20, according to a report released by NGO Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR). The BJP was followed by INC which received a total contribution of ₹133.04 crore from 154 corporate donors, and NCP with ₹57.086 crore in corporate donations. CPM received ₹6.9165 crore in corporate donations.

7.title: I've never traded stocks, I don't even have a brokerage account: Zoho CEO
7.article_body: Zoho's billionaire CEO Sridhar Vembu told Moneycontrol, "I have never actually traded. In fact, I don't even have a brokerage account." Stockbroking startup Zerodha's CEO Nithin Kamath, who was also a part of the conversation, was asked if he would make a pitch to add Vembu on Zerodha. "I don't think Sridhar has to invest in the markets," Kamath replied.

8.title: This is last time we saw him walk out of NZ team: Guptill on Ross' farewell
8.article_body: Speaking about his teammate Ross Taylor, who retired from the game on Monday, New Zealand opener Martin Guptill said, "This is it; this [against the Netherlands] is the last time we saw him walk out of...New Zealand team." He added, "It'll be even more emotional when we wake up tomorrow morning and Ross is no longer going to be there."

9.title: Russian oligarch's yacht worth $90 million seized by US in Spain
9.article_body: A yacht owned by a Russian oligarch, Viktor Vekselberg, with close ties to Russian President Vladimir Putin has been seized by US authorities in Spain's Mallorca on Monday. The Tango is believed to be worth approximately $90 million, according to US' Department of Justice. The action is a part of US' response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

10.title: We played a lot of loose shots: Haque on Bangladesh's Durban Test loss
10.article_body: Bangladesh skipper Mominul Haque said his side played loose shots in their second innings after they lost first Test against South Africa by 220 runs on Day 5 at Kingsmead, Durban. "Unfortunately, we lost three wickets last night, that was crucial...we also know that Durban spins from the third-fourth day, we didn't capitalise well with the bat," he added.

11.title: AAP hasn’t been in power for 4 days, raising Chandigarh issue now: Khattar
11.article_body: Talking about the ongoing row between Punjab and Haryana over Chandigarh, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar said, "They've (AAP) not been in power for four days and are raising these controversial issues". CM Khattar added, "Chandigarh issue should be resolved by sitting together, it's not something that can be passed unilaterally in Assembly."

12.title: Will protect interest of Supertech twin towers' homebuyers: SC
12.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday said it will protect the interest of homebuyers of Supertech's 40-storey twin towers in its Emerald Court project. The Supreme Court noted submissions of senior advocate S Ganesh, appearing for Supertech's ex-management, that of the 711 homebuyers, claims of 652 homebuyers had been settled. The remaining homebuyers need to be refunded ₹14.96 crore in total.

13.title: Will incur ₹2,285 crore on Central Vista project in FY23: Govt
13.article_body: Minister of State for Housing and Urban Affairs Kaushal Kishore on Monday said that an estimated ₹2,285 crore will be incurred in FY23 on redevelopment of the Central Vista Avenue. Kishore also denied claims that the project's cost had risen 29% to over ₹1,290 crore. The expenditure incurred on the project till date is ₹418.7 crore, he said.

14.title: Himachal to teach Bhagavad Gita to students from Class 9: Minister
14.article_body: The Himachal Pradesh government will teach Bhagavad Gita to all school students from Class 9, state Education Minister Govind Singh Thakur said. Earlier, the Gujarat government had announced making Bhagavad Gita a part of the school syllabus. Union Minister Pralhad Joshi had also said that every state government can think about introducing Bhagavad Gita as part of school syllabus.

15.title: It's 'jungle raj', never seen such 'anarchy' in Punjab: Sidhu on AAP
15.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday said that he's never seen such "anarchy" in Punjab and criticised the Aam Aadmi Party government for unleashing "jungle raj" in the state. "No one is afraid of law and order. Cold-blooded murders are being committed in broad daylight," Sidhu added. He further said that maintaining peace in Punjab should be the priority.

16.title: TN woman confronts molester with safety pin; gets him arrested
16.article_body: A Madras High Court advocate, who was allegedly harassed on a moving bus in Tamil Nadu, confronted the accused with a safety pin before handing him over to the police. The accused had slid his hands through the gap between the seats and touched her inappropriately. He began to shout and abuse when I confronted him, the woman said.

17.title: Oh hi lol: Elon Musk's first tweet after his 9.2% stake in Twitter disclosed
17.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "Oh hi lol," after his 9.2% passive stake in Twitter was disclosed on Monday. According to a regulatory filing, Musk, who has emerged as the biggest shareholder of Twitter, purchased the stake on March 14. Following the news, the shares of Twitter jumped as much as 26%, the most since 2018.

18.title: India's trade deficit rises by 87.5% to $192 billion in 2021-22
18.article_body: India's trade deficit rose by 87.5% from $102.63 billion in 2020-21 to $192.41 billion in 2021-22, government data showed on Monday. While total exports in FY22 rose to a record high of $417.81 billion, imports too soared 54.71% year-on-year to $610.22 billion on the back of rising global fuel and commodity prices. Merchandise imports in FY21 stood at $394.44 billion.

19.title: IndiGo Co-founder, who graduated from IIT Kanpur, gives ₹100 cr to the college
19.article_body: IndiGo airline's Co-founder Rakesh Gangwal, who did his B.Tech in Mechanical Engineering from IIT Kanpur in 1975, has donated ₹100 crore to the college. The contribution is focused on supporting the School of Medical Sciences & Technology at IIT Kanpur. Indian-American businessman Rakesh Gangwal, his wife and their daughter were present in person for the agreement signing in Mumbai.

20.title: Ukraine's claims of massacre in Bucha 'fake', our troops left on March 30: Russia
20.article_body: Denying allegations of an alleged massacre by Russian forces in Ukraine's Bucha, Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said that Ukraine staged "another fake attack". He added that Russian armed forces had left the town on March 30. On Saturday, Bucha Mayor Anatoliy Fedoruk said that around 300 civilians were killed in a Russian operation. Videos of bodies had surfaced online.

21.title: He's honest: 78-yr-old after transferring assets worth ₹50 lakh in Rahul's name
21.article_body: A 78-year-old woman from Uttarakhand's Dehradun has transferred all her property in Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's name. The woman, Pushpa Munjial, transferred assets worth ₹50 lakh and some gold in Rahul Gandhi's name. She said, "Rahul Gandhi is an innocent, honest man...he'll put my money into things that will be remembered...he's free to spend my money the way he wants."

22.title: Putin should face war crimes trial for atrocities in Ukraine: Biden
22.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Monday called Vladimir Putin a war criminal and said that he would call for a war crimes trial against the Russian President. Biden's comments come amid a global outcry over atrocities against civilians in Ukraine. The bodies of 410 civilians were removed from towns that were recently retaken from Russian forces, a Ukrainian official said.

23.title: Sri Lanka's economic condition is bad, but India's is worse: Mamata
23.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee on Monday said that India's financial condition is worse than Sri Lanka's and urged the Centre to call for an all-party meeting to address it. "Fuel prices have been hiked 11 times in 13 days. The interest on Provident Fund has been slashed. From railways to banks, everything is being sold off," Mamata said.

24.title: Didn't know role of producer when I joined film industry: Vidya
24.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has revealed that she was not aware of the producer's role in a film when she had started working in the industry. However, Vidya added she realised the producer's role after working in female-led films like 'Ishqiya' and 'No One Killed Jessica'. "The role of a producer and director is equally important for a film," she stated.

25.title: Aamir begins pre-production work of his next film with Ranbir: Report
25.article_body: Aamir Khan has reportedly started working on the pre-production of his upcoming film with Ranbir Kapoor. "This yet-to-be-titled project will be made on a massive scale...will have an important message for...audience," a source was quoted by Pinkvilla. Film's shooting will reportedly begin after the release of 'Laal Singh Chaddha'. "Aamir...Ranbir are very excited about the film," the source added.

26.title: I hate 'billionaire' stories, my son's friends look at us differently: Zerodha CEO
26.article_body: Zerodha CEO Nithin Kamath told Moneycontrol he hates 'billionaire' and 'unicorn' stories. "It creates a wrong image and affects everyone around us like my son's friends, his teachers, our neighbours...they look at us in a different way," Kamath said. "I used to play basketball with the kids and now they...treat me like a billionaire who can't be hurt," he added.

27.title: Krishna has all qualities to be India's successful all-format pacer: Buttler
27.article_body: Praising Prasidh Krishna, England wicketkeeper-batter Jos Buttler said the 26-year-old has got all the qualities to become a "very successful" fast bowler for India in all formats of the game. "He has some pace in...nets and skills...I see him playing red-ball cricket for India as well," he added. Krishna made his international debut in ODI format in March 2021.

28.title: Will ensure police remain ahead of criminals: Shah on Criminal Procedure Bill
28.article_body: Lok Sabha passed the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill by voice vote on Monday. Union Home Minister Amit Shah said the Bill has been brought in to ensure that police and investigators remain two steps ahead of criminals. The Bill seeks to provide legal sanction to police to take physical and biological samples of convicts and persons accused of crimes.

29.title: Nortje returns to training ahead of DC vs LSG, DC shares pic
29.article_body: Ahead of DC-LSG in IPL 2022, DC have posted a picture of pacer Anrich Nortje on Twitter practising in nets on Monday and wrote, "Nortje. Training. That's it. That's the post." Nortje hasn't played since T20I World Cup 2021 due to hip and back injuries. He has to get clearance from Cricket South Africa before making it to playing XI.

30.title: 2 labourers shot by militants in Pulwama, 2nd attack within 24 hrs
30.article_body: A day after two migrant workers were shot at and injured in south Kashmir, suspected militants fired at two more non-local labourers in Pulwama, reports said. The injured labourers have been shifted to the district hospital in Pulwama for treatment and are in stable condition, reports added. Both labourers are from Bihar, reports said.

31.title: Sri Lankan Opp'n rejects Prez's invite to join Cabinet amid crisis
31.article_body: Sri Lanka's largest opposition party, Samagi Jana Balawegaya, rejected an invitation from President Gotabaya Rajapaksa to form a unity government amid the economic crisis. Rajapaksa had invited "all political parties...to come together to accept ministerial portfolios in order to find solutions to this national crisis". All 26 Cabinet Ministers had resigned amid protests against the government.

32.title: Chintu, you've hit last ball out of stadium: Javed on 'Sharmaji...'
32.article_body: Lyricist Javed Akhtar took to Twitter on Monday and praised Rishi Kapoor and Paresh Rawal-starrer 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. "Watched 'Sharmaji Namkeen'. So well written and directed. Thank you Paresh saheb for your most unusual and great contribution," Javed tweeted. He further said, "Now my friend Chintu (Rishi), ultimately it's your show. You have hit the last ball out of the stadium."

33.title: Market for nuclear missiles, bombs to surge 73% by 2030: Report
33.article_body: The global market for nuclear missiles and bombs is estimated to surpass $126 billion by 2030, an Allied Market Research report said. This is a nearly 73% rise from the 2020 levels. The report has predicted that the fastest growth in this segment would come from Asia-Pacific region on initiatives by India, Pakistan and China to bolster their nuclear arsenals.

34.title: Our musicians wear body armour instead of tuxedos: Zelenskyy in Grammys address
34.article_body: While appearing in a pre-recorded video at Sunday night's Grammy Awards, Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said, "Our musicians wear body armour instead of tuxedos." "They sing to the wounded in hospitals. Even to those who can't hear them. But the music will break through anyway," he added. Zelenskyy urged, "Support us in any way you can...but not silence."

35.title: My high-pitched voice is 'manufacturing defect', I don't get angry: Amit Shah
35.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while speaking in the Lok Sabha on Monday, said, "My high-pitched voice is a manufacturing defect. I don't get angry." He added that he only gets angry on questions related to Kashmir. Shah moved the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill, 2022 for consideration and passage in the House.

36.title: Quite emotional: Keshav Maharaj on his 7/32 in 1st Test vs Bangladesh
36.article_body: South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj said he was "quite emotional" after his 7/32 in fourth innings of first Test led his side to a 220-run win against Bangladesh in Durban. Chasing a 274-run target, Bangladesh were bowled out for 53 runs in fourth innings. "Playing at home is always special. Glad...I could take the team over the line," he added.

37.title: It's special to score my ton vs Netherlands with Taylor on other end: Young
37.article_body: New Zealand batter Will Young said it was a "special moment" to have Ross Taylor on the other end when he scored his century (120) in third and final ODI against the Netherlands. The match was Taylor's 450th and last for New Zealand. "I tried to take the pressure off him and allowed him to enjoy the occasion," he added.

38.title: 3 shot dead by armed men over land dispute in Punjab's Gurdaspur
38.article_body: A group of armed men shot dead three persons in Punjab's Gurdaspur district on Monday over an alleged land dispute. The husband of a woman sarpanch, along with two others, was standing in his field, when the group reportedly arrived from Dasuya to take possession of the land. The group opened fire at the victims when they resisted the takeover.

39.title: Paytm Payments Bank yet to appoint firm for IT audit: Govt
39.article_body: Minister of State for Finance Bhagwat Karad said Paytm Payments Bank hasn't yet appointed a firm to conduct an audit of its IT systems. On March 11, RBI barred the bank from onboarding new customers and ordered it to appoint an audit firm. Order followed a report that the bank allegedly leaked data to Chinese entities, Bloomberg reported citing sources.

40.title: FIIs & FPIs may come and go, retail investors take care of markets: FM
40.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday said that retail investors have brought a shock-absorbing capacity into the Indian markets. "FIIs and FPIs may come and go but today the Indian retail investors have proven that any shock that may come in is now taken care of," she added. Sitharaman further informed Lok Sabha that the inflow of FDI remains unabated.

41.title: PM Modi congratulates Indian composer Ricky Kej for 2nd Grammy win
41.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday congratulated Indian music composer Ricky Kej for winning the second Grammy Award. Ricky won the award for 'Divine Tides' in Best New Age Album category. 'Congratulations for this remarkable feat and best wishes for your future endeavours!" PM Modi said in his congratulatory message to Ricky.

42.title: Virat is passionate about his cricket, wants to win every game: Kaul
42.article_body: RCB pacer Siddharth Kaul, in a conversation with Under-19 player Aneeshwar Gautam, said Virat Kohli will give Aneeshwar the "best guidance". "People around the world know about Virat's work ethic and fitness and how he's passionate about his cricket and how he just wants to win every game," Kaul added. Kaul and Virat have played together in the Under-19 team.

43.title: Halsey says 'Had to watch BTS', leaves Grammys early after surgery
43.article_body: Singer Halsey took to Instagram Stories on Sunday to announce that she left the 2022 Grammys early as she was not feeling well but had to see BTS perform before leaving. The South Korean boy band performed their English single 'Butter' at the ceremony. Halsey had earlier announced that she underwent surgery three days ahead of the Grammys.

44.title: My Instagram account hacked or suspended: Aishwarya Rajesh
44.article_body: Tamil actress Aishwarya Rajesh took to Twitter on Monday to announce that her Instagram account has either been hacked or suspended. The actress also tagged Instagram's official handle and asked them to help resolve the issue as soon as possible. This comes a day after actress Yami Gautam announced that her Instagram account may have been hacked.

45.title: Chandigarh belongs to Punjab, next battle for river waters: Sidhu
45.article_body: Congress leader Navjot Singh Sidhu on Monday said Chandigarh belongs to Punjab and will always remain so and added that its next big battle with Haryana will be over river waters. Built on 27 villages of Punjab, Chandigarh was, is and will remain a part of Punjab, Sidhu tweeted in Hindi.

46.title: Ishaan Khatter buys Triumph Bonneville Speed Twin bike worth ₹13 lakh
46.article_body: Actor Ishaan Khatter on Sunday took to Instagram to share a series of pictures of his new bike Triumph Bonneville Speed Twin which is worth ₹13 lakh. He wrote, "Au naturel with my new love, Speedy Gonzales." His brother Shahid Kapoor commented, "Look at this new biker boy in town," while his mother wrote, "Speedy Gonzales keep my boy safe."

47.title: Crypto payments worth ₹2.2 cr made in 11 drug trafficking cases: Govt
47.article_body: Narcotics Control Bureau and Central Board of Indirect Taxes and Customs have unearthed crypto payments worth ₹2.2 crore in 11 drug trafficking cases, Minister of State for Finance Pankaj Chaudhary said. Government is taking steps to check such usage, he added. Liaisoning with technical experts and coordination with foreign drug law enforcement agencies is being done regularly, Chaudhary said.

48.title: 'RRR' crosses ₹900 crore-mark globally, only 5th Indian film to do so: Reports
48.article_body: 'RRR' crossed the ₹900-crore mark globally on Sunday, trade analyst Manobala Vijayabalan tweeted. The film earned ₹82.40 crore on Sunday, taking its second weekend total to ₹192 crore and overall earnings to ₹901.46 crore. 'RRR' is reportedly the only fifth Indian film to cross the ₹900-crore mark after 'Dangal', 'Baahubali 2: The Conclusion', 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' and 'Secret Superstar'.

49.title: No sense for SRH to open the batting with Abhishek Sharma: Chopra
49.article_body: Former India cricketer Aakash Chopra has said that there is "no sense" for the Sunrisers Hyderabad to use their 21-year-old player Abhishek Sharma as an opening batter. "Don’t open with him [Sharma]. Instead, open with Rahul Tripathi and Washington Sundar...He [Sundar] is being wasted lower down the order...I would bat Abhishek Sharma at 6," Chopra said.

50.title: Russia imposes visa restrictions on citizens of 'unfriendly countries'
50.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin signed a decree for visa restrictions for citizens of countries that Russia deems "unfriendly" after sanctions over Ukraine. Russia suspended simplified visa issuance regime with some EU countries as well as Norway, Switzerland, Denmark and Iceland. In March, Russia approved a list of "unfriendly countries" including the US, Canada, Britain, EU states and Ukraine.

51.title: Pic of Rajasthan constable running to save child amid Karauli violence surfaces
51.article_body: A photo of a Rajasthan Police constable running past burning buildings while rescuing an infant amid violence in Karauli is being shared on social media. According to Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot, 31-year-old Netresh Sharma saved the lives of at least four people while performing his duty. Gehlot spoke to the constable and promoted him to the post of Head Constable.

52.title: Guj BJP youth unit to hold 3,000-km march to mark 75 yrs of Independence
52.article_body: The Gujarat BJP's youth unit will hold a statewide march, Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav Yatra, to mark 75 years of Independence. The march will begin on April 6 in Ahmedabad and will conclude on April 25 in Surat. According to Prashant Korat, state president of the Bharatiya Janata Yuva Morcha, the 3,000-km long march will have tableaus on Independence-related themes.

53.title: Didn't cry when parents died, cried at Anupam's death in Kashmir Files: Vivek
53.article_body: 'The Kashmir Files' director Vivek Agnihotri shared a behind-the-scenes video from the film's scene depicting Anupam Kher's character Pushkar Nath's death. He wrote, "When my mother died in 2004...When my father died in 2008, I didn't cry. But when I shot this death scene with Anupam Kher I couldn't stop...Such is the intensity of pain of our Kashmiri Hindu parents."

54.title: Sunday meets with fans at Jalsa to be revived perhaps: Amitabh Bachchan
54.article_body: Actor Amitabh Bachchan, who called off his weekly meet-and-greet with his fans at Jalsa in March 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic, has hinted at reviving the meets. Taking to his blog, Amitabh wrote, "News about...Mumbai is that no more masks and protocol of COVID...which comes as a blessing...perhaps the Sunday meets at the Jalsa gate...to be revived."

55.title: It was pretty special: Elgar on SA's 1st Test win against Bangladesh
55.article_body: Describing South Africa's 220-run victory against Bangladesh in the first Test as "pretty special", South Africa captain Dean Elgar said it was a hard-fought win in Durban. "It's not often we've had a Test go into five days...been a hard graft playing in conditions that we're not used to seeing," he added. South Africa are 1-0 ahead in two-match series.

56.title: 2 hikers dead, 2 injured in landslide in Australia's Blue Mountains
56.article_body: Two hikers, including a 9-year-old boy, were killed and two others were critically injured on Monday in a landslide in the Blue Mountains in Australia's New South Wales state. The injured hikers have suffered head and abdominal injuries, paramedics said. The victims are British nationals who were holidaying in Australia, according to a police statement.

57.title: 18-yr-old Alcaraz beats Ruud to become youngest Miami Open men's champion
57.article_body: Fourteenth seed Carlos Alcaraz defeated sixth seed Casper Ruud 7-5, 6-4 in Miami Open final to win his first ATP Masters 1000 title on Sunday. Notably, 18-year-old Alcaraz is the youngest Miami men's champion in the event's 37-year-old history and first Spanish man to win in Miami after eight previous final appearances by his compatriots, including five by Rafael Nadal.

58.title: SRH to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash, playing XIs out
58.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson won the toss and elected to bowl first against LSG in their IPL 2022 clash. SRH are fielding the same playing XI that featured in their IPL 2022 opener against RR. LSG have made one change to their playing XI, with bowling all-rounder Jason Holder replacing Dushmantha Chameera.

59.title: Woman cheats Pune techie of ₹9 lakh through matrimonial site, arrested
59.article_body: A woman, sought by Pune's Koregaon Park Police on charges of cheating a 36-year-old IT company worker of ₹9.25 lakh last year, has been caught in Goa. According to police, the accused, Reema Sandhu, contacted the victim using a fake profile on a matrimonial website and later asked him to transfer money on pretext of requiring help for legal case.

60.title: Online exams to fill 128 medical posts from 19,015 applications: PCMC
60.article_body: The Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation has received 19,015 applications for 128 medical posts, that will be filled through online examinations. All the posts are permanent, but no interviews will be conducted, officials said. Assistant Municipal Commissioner Balasaheb Khandekar said that arrangements are underway to make examination rooms available in different districts.

61.title: Only 10% kids in 12-14 age group COVID-19 vaccinated in Mumbai: BMC
61.article_body: Around 38,365 of the 4 lakh children between 12 and 14 years of age have been vaccinated against COVID-19 in Mumbai, which is only 10% of the targeted population, according to BMC data. Health department officials said the response to the drive, which began on March 16, has been lower than expected due to the dip in the daily cases.

62.title: Free solar mobile charging unit installed in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar
62.article_body: A free solar-powered mobile charging unit has been installed in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar, which is a first in the area. MLC Balaram Patil, who inaugurated the unit at a sector 15 bus stand on the occasion of Gudi Padwa said, "This is a state-of-the-art concept that'll benefit...common man." Earlier, a similar unit was set up in the New Panvel area.

63.title: Ross Taylor breaks down during national anthem in his last int'l match, video viral
63.article_body: Ross Taylor, who played his last international cricket match today, broke down when New Zealand's national anthem was being played ahead of the third ODI against Netherlands. Taylor's children also accompanied him during the national anthem. Taylor played 112 Tests, 236 ODIs and 102 T20Is in his career, scoring 18,195 runs.

64.title: Economic crisis makes Sri Lankan stocks world's worst performers after Russia
64.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's worst economic crisis, the country's stocks have fallen about 33% in 2022, making them the world's worst performers after Russian equities. In 2021, the Sri Lanka Colombo Stock Exchange had rallied 80%, posting the world's best performance after Mongolia. On Monday, the central bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal resigned amid soaring inflation and fuel shortage.

65.title: 2nd Grammy win is beautiful recognition of my life choices: Ricky Kej
65.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej said that winning a second Grammy award is a "beautiful recognition" of his life choices. Ricky won the award for 'Divine Tides' in Best New Age Album category. "I feel strongly about making this world...better place, that's the only kind of music that I make," he stated. Ricky won his first Grammy award in 2015.

66.title: Heartbreaking to see what Sri Lanka is going through: Jacqueline
66.article_body: Amid Sri Lanka's economic crisis and emergency, actress Jacqueline Fernandez took to Instagram to support her native country. "As a Sri Lankan, it's heartbreaking to see what my country and countrymen are going through," she wrote. "I'm hoping this situation comes to an end soon and through means which are peaceful and for the benefit of the people," she added.

67.title: Delhi govt will draw summer action plan to fight pollution: Minister
67.article_body: The Delhi government will prepare a 14-point summer action plan to fight pollution in the capital, Environment Minister Gopal Rai said on Monday. He said the plan will focus on open burning of garbage, fires at landfill sites, increasing green cover on the roadside, rejuvenation of water bodies, parks, tree transplantation monitoring, development of an eco-waste park and more.

68.title: Meat shops should be shut during Navratri: South Delhi Mayor to officers
68.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation on Monday issued an order asking officers concerned to take action for the closure of meat shops during Navratri till April 11. The order issued by Mayor Mukkesh Suryaan said, "In these days...sight of meat being sold in open and near temples makes [people] uncomfortable." It added, "Their religious belief and sentiments are also affected."

69.title: Ram Charan gifts gold coins to 35 'RRR' technicians; pics surface
69.article_body: Actor Ram Charan gifted gold coins to nearly 35 unit members of his film 'RRR' after inviting them over for a meal at his residence in Hyderabad. He presented them with sweets and a gold coin, each weighing 11.6 grams, reports said. The technicians included various heads of filmmaking departments like direction and camera, production managers, still photographers, and accountants.

70.title: Ananya Panday and Ishaan Khatter break up after 3 years: Reports
70.article_body: Actors Ananya Panday and Ishaan Khatter have broken up after dating for three years, media reports, including those from Pinkvilla and TOI, said on Monday. "They bonded well on the sets of 'Khaali Peeli' and that led to the beginning of a new journey," Pinkvilla reported. "It has been a mutual call...and things ended on a positive note," it added.

71.title: KGF 2 to be 1st South film to release in Greece, breaks UK pre-sale record
71.article_body: Yash-starrer 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' will become the first South Indian film to be released in Greece on April 14. The advance booking for the film began in the UK and sold 5,000 tickets within 12 hours which is the highest ever for any Indian film. 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' will also be released in the US and South America.

72.title: Varun shares old video with Triple H as he retires from WrestleMania
72.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan on Monday took to Instagram to share an old video of him interacting with wrestler Triple H after the latter announced his retirement from WrestleMania. He wrote, "One of my all-time favourite WWE superstars hung up his boots at WrestleMania. I was fortunate enough to...talk to him about my love of pro wrestling and the rock."

73.title: I shut out everyone, was only talking to Rohit and Mahi bhai: Pant on getting dropped
73.article_body: Talking about the time when he was dropped from India's limited-overs squad in 2019, Rishabh Pant said, "It was a hard time...I shut out everyone." "It was difficult for me to go to many people. I wanted to prove myself to the world. I was only talking to Rohit Sharma and Mahi bhai (MS Dhoni) a  little bit," he said.

74.title: CCI orders probe into Zomato and Swiggy
74.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) on Monday ordered an investigation into the conduct of online food delivery platforms Zomato and Swiggy. "There exists a prima facie case with respect to some of the conduct of Zomato and Swiggy," the CCI said. The antitrust body will probe allegations including delayed payment cycle, imposition of one-sided clauses and exorbitant commission.

75.title: Vinay Mohan Kwatra to be next Foreign Secretary: Govt
75.article_body: Vinay Mohan Kwatra, India's Ambassador to Nepal, will be the next Foreign Secretary, an official statement said on Monday. The 1988-batch Indian Foreign Service (IFS) officer will succeed Harsh Vardhan Shringla, who is set to retire at the end of April. From August 2017 to February 2020, Kwatra had served as the Indian Ambassador to France.

76.title: You've been great ambassador of the game: Tendulkar to Ross on retirement
76.article_body: Calling Ross Taylor a "great ambassador" of the game, Sachin Tendulkar took to Twitter to congratulate the New Zealand batter on his retirement. "It was wonderful playing against you. The way you reinvented yourself over...years to adapt is an inspiration for all...young kids aspiring to be cricketers," he wrote. Taylor played 450 international matches for New Zealand across all formats.

77.title: Car rams into pile of timber on Pune-Mumbai highway; 2 killed
77.article_body: Two people from Thane were killed and one more was seriously injured after their car rammed into a pile of timber on the Pune-Mumbai old highway on Monday, reports said. Inspector Sanjay Jagtap, in-charge of the Kamshet Police Station, said that the container had turned on its side and the timber spilt onto the Mumbai bound lane.

78.title: Russia condemns Poland's comment on hosting US nuclear weapons
78.article_body: Russia on Monday condemned a comment by Polish Deputy PM Jarosław Kaczyński after he said Poland would be open to having US nuclear weapons on its soil. Russia also said that such a move would only lead to heightened tensions in the region. Tensions between Poland and Russia have been high over the conflict in Ukraine.

79.title: KL Rahul has the ability to be the finisher for LSG: Sunil Gavaskar
79.article_body: Ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said LSG captain KL Rahul has the "ability" to be a finisher for his team. "Rahul's not just somebody who can begin the innings...get the team off to...good start. He has all the shots in the book to finish it off as well," Gavaskar added. In IPL 2022, Rahul has scored 40 runs in two matches.

80.title: Pacer Avesh Khan is a fabulous prospect for Team India: Gavaskar
80.article_body: Ex-India batter Sunil Gavaskar said LSG pacer Avesh Khan is a "fabulous" prospect for Team India. "Avesh is...very good prospect...don't care what people say about him," Gavaskar stated. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Avesh has scalped three wickets in two matches with the economy being over nine. Avesh has represented India in two T20Is and has taken two wickets.

81.title: 3,697 DTC buses equipped with panic buttons, CCTVs: Delhi govt
81.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot said 3,697 Delhi Transport Corporation (DTC) buses are equipped with panic buttons and CCTV cameras. He added that as of March 21, 9,181 marshals were also deployed in DTC buses. DTC managed monthly savings of ₹2.32 crore in FY21 with income in the same fiscal at ₹454.42 crore, the Delhi Transport Department said.

82.title: Imran Khan proposes Pakistan's ex-Chief Justice Gulzar Ahmed as caretaker PM
82.article_body: Imran Khan, who was de-notified as the PM of Pakistan, has proposed the name of former Chief Justice Gulzar Ahmed as caretaker PM. Earlier, President Arif Alvi said Khan would continue as PM until the appointment of a caretaker premier. Alvi had also reportedly asked Leader of the Opposition in the outgoing National Assembly, Shehbaz Sharif, to propose a name.

83.title: It's condemnable: K'taka Minister on KTR's 'Move to Hyd' remark
83.article_body: Karnataka Minister CN Ashwathnarayan criticised Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao for suggesting a Bengaluru-based entrepreneur to shift to Hyderabad for better facilities. Ashwathnarayan said it was condemnable. "The tweet wasn't in a good taste...Trying to pull the legs of each other does not go well for any government," Ashwathnarayan added.

84.title: Chhattisgarh tops states with lowest unemployment rate in March: Govt
84.article_body: Chhattisgarh has been ranked first among states with the lowest unemployment rate in the country in March, an official statement said on Monday. "The state government took several steps and formulated new policies for generating employment opportunities, especially for the youth," the release said, citing data by the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy.

85.title: China sends military to help test Shanghai residents for COVID-19
85.article_body: China has sent 2,000 medical personnel from the military to help test the residents of Shanghai amid a COVID-19 outbreak. Thousands of healthcare workers from across China were also sent to Shanghai to help fight one of the biggest COVID-19 outbreaks in the country so far. Authorities had launched mass testing and imposed a lockdown under China's 'zero-COVID' strategy.

86.title: Video shows Russian helicopter splitting into 2 after being hit by Ukrainian missile
86.article_body: A Russian Mi-28 helicopter was seen splitting into two after being hit by a missile launched by Ukrainian forces. A video of the incident surfaced on social media. As per reports, Ukraine used Starstreak, the UK's most advanced manned portable missile system. In March, the UK said it'll supply Ukraine with anti-aircraft missiles to help it defend itself from Russia.

87.title: COVID-19 medicines sold at 5% GST, others at 5-12%: MoS Finance
87.article_body: Pankaj Chaudhary, the Union Minister of State (MoS) for Finance, on Monday said that COVID-19 medicines and instruments are being sold at a GST rate of 5%. Other medicines have been sold at a GST rate between 5-12% since the pandemic started, he added. He said the GST rate for health insurance is 18%, which is as per international standards.

88.title: New York street named Ganesh Temple Street after N America's oldest Hindu temple
88.article_body: A street outside a prominent temple in Flushing, Queens Borough in New York has been co-named the Ganesh Temple Street. Queens Borough's President Donovan Richards shared a video of the ceremony. Established in 1977, The Hindu Temple Society of North America Sri Maha Vallabha Ganapati Devasthanam is regarded as the first and oldest Hindu Temple in North America.

89.title: Mission to bring Delhi CM Kejriwal's 'good governance' to B'luru: Rao
89.article_body: Former Bengaluru Police Commissioner B Bhaskar Rao joined Aam Aadmi Party on Monday and said that his mission was to bring Delhi Chief Minister's "good governance" to South India, especially Bengaluru. He further stated that he was impressed with Kejriwal's leadership. Rao joined AAP in the presence of Delhi CM Kejriwal and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia.

90.title: Driver killed, 34 injured as Shimla-bound bus hits a wall in Mandi
90.article_body: A roadways bus hit a wall on the Chandigarh-Manali National Highway in Himachal Pradesh's Mandi on Monday, killing the driver and injuring 34 people. The bus was on its way to Shimla from Manali. The injured people were shifted to a nearby hospital, Mandi Superintendent of Police Shalini Agnihotri said.

91.title: College textbook allegedly listing 'Merits of dowry' goes viral; Twitter users react
91.article_body: A snippet of a college textbook listing 'Merits of dowry', claimed to be from a Sociology Book for Nurses, has gone viral on Twitter. The book reads, "Ugly looking girls can be married off with an attractive dowry with well or ugly looking guys." Several Twitter users criticised it with tweets like, "This is making me sick" and "Appalling".

92.title: Elon Musk becomes Twitter's largest shareholder with 9.2% stake
92.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk has become the largest shareholder of Twitter after he disclosed that he owns a 9.2% passive stake in the platform. It's more than quadruple the 2.25% stake held by Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey. Notably, Musk conducted a Twitter poll last month asking users whether Twitter adheres to the principle of free speech.

93.title: HDFC-HDFC Bank combined entity will be among world's 100 most-valued firms
93.article_body: The combined entity formed out of the HDFC Bank-HDFC merger will be among the world's 100 most-valued firms in terms of market capitalisation, as per Bloomberg data. The entity will likely be worth $190 billion (over ₹14 lakh crore), making it the 63rd most-valued company globally. Currently, Apple is the world's most-valued company with a market value of $2.84 trillion.

94.title: Let’s focus on infra, not on halal & hijab: KTR to K'taka Cong chief
94.article_body: Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday replied to Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar, who had said that the party will restore the glory of Bengaluru by 2023. "Let's focus on infrastructure, IT and BT, not on halal and hijab," Rao tweeted. He added, "Let Hyderabad and Bengaluru compete healthily on creating jobs for...youngsters and prosperity for our great nation."

95.title: You left it better than you found it: McCullum on Taylor's retirement
95.article_body: Following New Zealand batter Ross Taylor's retirement after playing his last match in Hamilton, against the Netherlands, Brendon McCullum congratulated him. "You left it better than you found it. 'Gather ye'. May...next stage be as great as the last," he tweeted. The 38-year-old is highest run-scorer for New Zealand in Test and ODI formats with 7,683 and 8,607 runs respectively.

96.title: Indonesian teacher sentenced to death for raping 13 minor girls
96.article_body: An Indonesian court handed down a death sentence to Herry Wirawan, a teacher who raped 13 girls at an Islamic school. He had initially received a sentence of life in prison. Between 2016 and 2021, Wirawan sexually groomed the 13 girls, who were between 12 and 16 years old, and impregnated eight of his victims, a judge said earlier.

97.title: Delhi Police arrests 57, seize 679 litres of liquor in last 24 hrs
97.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 57 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and seized 679 litres of illicit liquor in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 14 proclaimed offenders and recovered seven stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,236 calls, the post added.

98.title: It's not a pan-India film but a 'Hindustani' film: Sanjay on 'KGF 2'
98.article_body: Sanjay Dutt in an interview spoke about his upcoming movie 'KGF: Chapter 2', which will release in multiple languages, including Kannada, Hindi, Tamil, Malayalam and Telugu. He said that it's wrong to call it a Kannada or south movie. Sanjay added it's "not even a pan-India film but a 'Hindustani' film". Directed by Prashanth Neel, the film also stars Yash.

99.title: Shilpa gets trolled for 'ignoring' Harnaaz on 'India's Got...', fan says 'Shameful'
99.article_body: Miss Universe 2021 Harnaaz Kaur Sandhu recently appeared as a guest on 'India's Got Talent 9'. In a video, Harnaaz is seen walking up to the judges' panel where Shilpa Shetty and Badshah are seated. As Harnaaz approached the judges, they congratulated her for winning the title. However, fans trolled Shilpa for ignoring Harnaaz. One of the users commented, "Shameful".

100.title: Kohli congratulates Taylor on his final int'l game, says you've been a legend
100.article_body: Virat Kohli congratulated New Zealand's Ross Taylor as he played his last international game against the Netherlands on Monday. "Congratulations on a wonderful career...You've been a legend for New Zealand cricket. You have been a great ambassador for the game and we've shared some amazing memories together," said Kohli in a video posted by NZ cricket.

101.title: Mumbai man gets bank’s fake number from internet, loses ₹2.77 lakh
101.article_body: A 61-year-old Mumbai businessman lost ₹2.77 lakh to cyber fraud after he picked up fake number of his bank from the internet. The businessman called up a cyber fraudster while trying to call the bank to activate his credit card. "He [fraudster] said I will receive...OTP...on my phone to update my address...He asked me to share OTP," businessman told police.

102.title: Over ₹53,000 crore owed to states as FY22's GST compensation: Govt
102.article_body: The central government still owes ₹53,489 crore to states and UTs in GST compensation for the period between April 2021 and January 2022, the Finance Ministry said on Monday. Of this, the maximum amount is owed to Maharashtra at ₹11,563 crore. The Centre borrowed ₹1.59 lakh crore in FY22 to make up for the shortfall in GST compensation cess collections.

103.title: Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed within a year: Nitin Gadkari
103.article_body: Union Minister for Road Transport and Highways, Nitin Gadkari, has announced that the work on the Mumbai-Goa highway will be completed within a year. The work on the Mumbai-Goa highway is underway in 11 phases. Gadkari said that the initial work on the highway was delayed due to land acquisition and taking permissions from the Railways and Forest Department.

104.title: Bangladesh record their 2nd lowest total in Test cricket history
104.article_body: Bangladesh recorded their second-lowest total in Test cricket history after being dismissed for 53 runs in their second innings in first Test against South Africa in Durban. Only two Bangladeshi batters managed to score in double-digits, with Najmul Hossain Shanto top-scoring with 26 runs. South Africa dismissed Bangladesh in 19 overs using only two bowlers (Keshav Maharaj and Simon Harmer).

105.title: MP's 56-year-old IAS officer Shailbala Martin to marry senior journalist Rakesh Pathak
105.article_body: Madhya Pradesh's 56-year-old IAS officer Shailbala Martin, who's currently posted as Additional Secretary in General Administration department of the state government, will tie the knot with senior journalist Rakesh Pathak. The 57-year-old journalist took to Facebook to announce the news, saying they have been in a relationship for two years. Pathak lost his first wife Pratima to cancer in 2015.

106.title: If everything falls into place, we might make it: 'Baahubali' maker on part 3
106.article_body: 'Baahubali' director SS Rajamouli, during an event, hinted at the possibility of part three in the franchise, saying that the announcement about the project will come at the right time. Reacting to Rajamouli's statement, producer Prasad Devineni said, "Definitely at some point, we might make it, if everything falls into place. But there's no effort being put in right now."

107.title: It's a fact we're not happy: BTS on losing Grammy to Doja Cat
107.article_body: South Korean band BTS held an Instagram Live session on Monday after the 2022 Grammys. The band, whose single 'Butter' was nominated in the best pop duo/group performance category, lost to Doja Cat's 'Kiss Me More'. "It's a fact that we're not happy. But I think it's good to be honest about how we feel," the band's rapper RM said.

108.title: Biden calls for new gun laws as 6 die in California mass shooting
108.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Sunday called on Congress to reform gun laws "urgently" after six people were killed in a mass shooting in California's Sacramento. He said that there should be a ban on "ghost guns" and a requirement for background checks for all gun sales, among others. "We must do more than mourn; we must act," he added.

109.title: Band Foo Fighters wins 3 Grammys week after drummer's death
109.article_body: Rock Band Foo Fighters won all three Grammys that they were nominated in the categories Best Rock Album, Best Rock Performance and Best Rock Song. This comes just over a week after the band's drummer Taylor Hawkins passed at the age of 50. Taylor's body was reportedly found in his hotel room before the band was to perform in Colombia.

110.title: Sometimes press ask stupid questions: John on his outburst at a journalist
110.article_body: John Abraham addressed his angry outburst at a journalist recently during the promotions of his upcoming film 'Attack'. This came after John was asked about 'the unrealistic action sequences in his movies'. Losing his cool, John called the journalist "dumb". Now in a recent interview, John said, "[Sometimes press] ask...stupid questions...I...get riled up when I get asked a stupid question."

111.title: India continues to remain highest receiver of FDI: FM Sitharaman
111.article_body: India has been the highest receiver of foreign direct investment (FDI) since before COVID-19 and continues to be so even now, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said. She added that Indian retail investors have created the capacity to absorb shocks due to outflow of foreign funds. Earlier, data showed that foreign portfolio investors withdrew ₹1.48 lakh crore from October 2021-March 2022.

112.title: Russians raped 10-yr-old girls, marked women's bodies with 'swastika burns': Ukraine MP
112.article_body: Ukrainian MP Lesia Vasylenko has claimed Russian soldiers in Ukraine raped girls as young as 10 years old and branded women's bodies with "swastika-shaped burns". She tweeted, "Russian soldiers loot, rape and kill. 10 y.o. girls with vaginal and rectal tears." Vasylenko shared a photo of 'swastika-shaped burn' on the "tortured body of a raped and killed woman" on Twitter.

113.title: $71 billion wiped out of market cap of Singapore's Grab and Sea in 3 months
113.article_body: Singapore's two largest new-economy companies have lost a combined $71 billion from their market capitalisation this year. While shares of ride-hailing company Grab have more than halved in the last three months, technology giant Sea's stock price has plunged by 46%. Sea-owned Shopee recently shut down India operations, whereas its Free Fire game was banned by the Indian government.

114.title: IIT grad attacks policemen with sharp weapon outside Gorakhnath temple
114.article_body: A 29-year-old IIT graduate armed with a sharp-edged weapon was arrested after he attacked two policemen outside the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Sunday. Identified as Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, he allegedly tried to break into the temple, raising religious slogans. A "terror attack" cannot be ruled out, the UP police said, adding that ATS will probe the incident.

115.title: Nawab Malik's judicial custody extended till April 18
115.article_body: A special Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA) court has extended Maharashtra Minister Nawab Malik's judicial custody till April 18 in Mumbai on Monday. Earlier, the special court had allowed Malik to be provided with home-cooked food and medicines during his custody period. Notably, the NCP leader was held in a money laundering case by the Enforcement Directorate in February.

116.title: BSF seizes intruding Pakistani fishing boat off Gujarat coast
116.article_body: The Border Security Force said it seized a Pakistani fishing boat that was intruding into Indian territory near Gujarat's Kutch on Sunday. The BSF said it noticed the movement of two Pakistani boats and four or five fishermen. The patrol chased the fishermen and seized one of the fishing boats about 100 metres inside Indian territory, said BSF.

117.title: I don't know why people take liberties with Alia, Ranbir: Randhir
117.article_body: Veteran actor Randhir Kapoor in an interview has stated that he doesn't know why people take liberties with actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor. He was reacting to the rumours of the couple getting married in April at the RK House. "They are to get married in the RK house? I have heard no such thing," the actor added.

118.title: PBKS can beat strongest sides in IPL 2022: Aakash after win over CSK
118.article_body: Ex-India opener Aakash Chopra, speaking about Punjab Kings' 54-run win against Chennai Super Kings, has said, "PBKS are a team who can beat the strongest sides." Aakash added that Punjab have looked "destructive" and "explosive" side in the ongoing IPL 2022. "They're in my list of favourites," he stated. PBKS have won two out of their three IPL 2022 matches.

119.title: Harmanpreet's hat-trick helps India beat England 4-3 in FIH Pro League
119.article_body: After winning against England on Saturday, India defeated them again by 4-3 in the FIH Pro League match in Bhubaneswar on Sunday. Indian defender Harmanpreet Singh was yet again adjudged the 'Player of the Match' for scoring a hat-trick on Sunday. India is now placed at the top of the FIH Pro League table with 21 points from 10 matches.

120.title: Man stabs 75-yr-old landlord to death in Ahmedabad over rent dispute
120.article_body: Police arrested a youth on Saturday night for allegedly stabbing to death his landlord, a 75-year-old man in Memnagar of Ahmedabad, over a rent-related dispute. Vivek Desai, the son of the deceased, in his complaint, mentioned that his father was sitting outside an eatery when the accused came and stabbed him in his stomach and neck.

121.title: Using loudspeakers outside mosques disturbs students, patients: K'taka minister
121.article_body: After Maharashtra Navnirman Sena chief Raj Thackeray opposed to the use of loudspeakers at mosques, Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa on Monday said using loudspeakers to call for prayer disturbs students and patients. "I have no objections to you (Muslims) offering prayers...If prayers are offered at temples and churches in a similar way, it'll lead to conflict between communities," he added.

122.title: I don't say this enough but Aishwarya is an unbelievable mom: Abhishek
122.article_body: When asked if he's the kind of father who helps his daughter Aaradhya Bachchan with her homework, Abhishek Bachchan denied and said, "I tried once or twice but that’s completely Aishwarya. She's an unbelievable mother for her dedication to Aaradhya." "I don't...say that enough, but due to her dedication...I get to go out and do what I do," he added.

123.title: My spin bowling will come into play later in the IPL: Livingstone
123.article_body: Punjab Kings all-rounder Liam Livingstone said that he hopes that his spin bowling will "come into play" as IPL goes on. "Bowling is something I really enjoy. Something I’ve spent a lot of time on. Been nice to contribute," Livingstone said. "Hopefully as the tournament goes on, my spin comes into play," he added after bagging two wickets against CSK.

124.title: During Ramzan, use of sirens by mosques annoys people: Sri Rama Sene
124.article_body: Sri Rama Sene's Siddalinga Swamiji has reportedly asked the ruling Bharatiya Janata Party to take action against those who play 'Azaan' on loudspeakers. "During the time of Ramzan, the use of sirens by mosques also annoys people. The state should step in and take action," he said. Earlier MNS chief Raj Thackeray demanded removal of mosque loudspeakers.

125.title: Suspected militants kill 21 civilians in Congo village
125.article_body: At least 21 civilians were killed in Congo's Masambo village in an attack by militants suspected to be from Allied Democratic Forces (ADF), said a human rights group called Ruenzori Sector Civil Society. "It is a miracle I survived. We were already in bed when we heard the sound of boots outside and bullets," said a resident.

126.title: Indian shuttler Mithun Manjunath wins silver at 2022 Orleans Masters
126.article_body: Indian shuttler Mithun Manjunath won a silver medal at the 2022 Orleans Masters in France after losing to Frenchman Toma Junior Popov in the final on Sunday. The world number 79 was defeated by 32nd ranked Popov 21-11, 21-19 in 50 minutes. It was Manjunath's maiden BWF final. Earlier, India's Sai Praneeth, the top seed, lost in the pre-quarterfinals.

127.title: Man United no longer favourites for top 4, says manager Ralf Rangnick
127.article_body: Manchester United interim manager Ralf Rangnick said they're no longer favourites to finish inside the top four of the Premier League after they were held to a 1-1 draw by Leicester City. "For us, it's...our job...to finish this season on the highest and best possible note," he added. United are currently placed 7th on the points table.

128.title: Elon Musk discloses 9.2% stake in Twitter
128.article_body: World's richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk has disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in Twitter, Bloomberg reported citing a US Securities and Exchange Commission filing. Following the news, shares of the social media platform jumped more than 25% in pre-market trading in the US. Musk's stake is worth around $2.89 billion, based on Twitter's closing price on Friday.

129.title: Pant is an important player, no longer in 'can be dropped' category: Rathour
129.article_body: Team India batting coach Vikram Rathour has termed India wicketkeeper-batter Rishabh Pant as a "mature player", who is no longer in the "can be dropped" category. "Pant has suddenly grown up. Rohit and Dravid are in the saddle now, and they know he's an important player in the India setup," stated Rathour. "Pant is getting better and better," he added.

130.title: Gurugram Police book 2 for kidnapping 2 drivers
130.article_body: Gurugram Police have booked a private company's owner and foreman for allegedly kidnapping two drivers in the district's Bilaspur area on Saturday night. The complaint was lodged by the wife of one of the victims. "It appears that the accused had enmity with two other people, who were known to the victims, from their village," an official said.

131.title: Delhi High Court allows journalist Rana Ayyub to travel abroad
131.article_body: The Delhi High Court has allowed journalist Rana Ayyub to travel abroad but imposed certain conditions. The court has asked her to inform the agencies where she was staying and deposit some money. She was earlier stopped at the Mumbai airport on the basis of a look out circular issued by the ED against her in a money laundering case.

132.title: I slap back: Vir reacts to troll who says he deserves a slap like Chris Rock
132.article_body: Comedian-actor Vir Das reacted to a troll who said he "deserves to be" slapped like Chris Rock. This came after Vir shared a picture of his dishevelled hair, and jokingly wrote. "There's mutiny [in]...hair." Commenting on it, a user wrote, "Someone needs to do a Will Smith on this one. Responding to this, Vir wrote, "Just know I slap back."

133.title: Sri Lanka Prez names 4 ministers after Cabinet members resigned
133.article_body: Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa on Monday appointed four ministers after members of the Cabinet resigned amid the ongoing economic crisis in the country. Ali Sabry has been named as the new Finance Minister, replacing Basil Rajapaksa, while GL Peiris will reportedly continue as the Foreign Minister. The previous ministers of Education and Highway have reportedly been retained.

134.title: Payal apologises to Muslims after calling Zeeshan terrorist on 'Lock Upp'
134.article_body: Actress Payal Rohatgi has apologised to Indian Muslims with folded hands for hurting their sentiments on reality show 'Lock Upp'. This comes after her fight with fellow contestant Zeeshan Khan during which she said he is disgusting for promoting halal meat and called him a terrorist. Zeeshan told Payal to get her lawyer ready for taking it to another level.

135.title: 14-year-old girl repeatedly raped for 25 days in Gwalior
135.article_body: A 14-year-old girl was repeatedly raped for 25 days by a 23-year-old man she met online eight months ago, police said. The girl had gone missing on March 7 after leaving the house to meet a friend. Based on the location of the victim's mobile phone and CCTV camera footage, police rescued her and arrested the accused from Hastinapur.

136.title: Not forcing hijab-clad teachers for exam duty: Karnataka Edu Min
136.article_body: Karnataka Education Minister BC Nagesh has said that teachers who "insist on wearing hijab" will not be forced to take up the exam invigilator's role. "As hijab is not allowed inside...We have given them the option to take exam duty or not," Nagesh said. Notably, seven teachers have been suspended for allowing hijab-clad students to sit for the board exam.

137.title: Will restore B'luru's glory as best city: Shivakumar; KTR says, 'challenge accepted'
137.article_body: Responding to Telangana Minister KT Rama Rao's tweet asking a startup to shift its base from Bengaluru to Hyderabad owing to the latter's "better infrastructure", Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar said he "accepts Rao's challenge". "By 2023-end, with Congress back in power...we'll restore the glory of Bengaluru as India's best city," Shivakumar added. "Challenge accepted," said Rao in reply.

138.title: I can't be on board of merged bank, I've crossed 75 yrs of age: HDFC Chairman
138.article_body: HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Monday that he will not be on the board of the merged entity, once HDFC combines with HDFC Bank. "The RBI does not allow anyone above the age of 75 years to be on the board of a bank. I have already crossed that age," the 77-year-old said. Parekh had joined HDFC in 1978.

139.title: 14-year-old boy killed in animal attack in Sanjay Tiger Reserve in MP
139.article_body: A 14-year-old boy was mauled to death by an unidentified wild animal in the Sanjay Tiger Reserve (STR) in Madhya Pradesh's Sidhi district, forest officials said on Monday. Villagers claimed that the boy was killed in the attack by a tiger. The victim's body was found near a river, where he had taken his cattle to graze.

140.title: 'Halal' definitely not for anybody outside of Islam: Lucky Ali on halal controversy
140.article_body: Singer Lucky Ali wrote on Facebook, "Halal is definitely not for anybody outside of Islam." He said, "Muslims won't buy any product just like Jewish who understand Halal as being similar to Kosher and won't buy products that aren't certified." He added, "Companies want to sell...to everyone...If people are...so bothered by the word 'halal'...they should remove it from their counters."

141.title: Team of 2022 Women's World Cup announced, no Indian included
141.article_body: The ICC have announced the Team of 2022 Women's World Cup, which doesn't feature any Indian player. Australia skipper Meg Lanning has been named the captain of the side. The team also features tournament's top two run-scorers, Australia's Alyssa Healy and Rachael Haynes. The team also includes Bangladesh's Salma Khatun, the only Asian in the XI.

142.title: New Royal Enfield bike explodes after catching fire in Andhra Pradesh, video surfaces
142.article_body: A video surfaced online showing a new Royal Enfield bike exploding after catching fire in Anantapur district of Andhra Pradesh. The bike was parked outside a temple when the incident happened. The cause of the fire hasn't been ascertained yet. As per reports, the owner of the bike had ridden it non-stop for around 390 km to reach the temple.

143.title: Sensex ends 1,335 points higher at 60,612, HDFC & HDFC Bank gain 9% each
143.article_body: The Sensex jumped 1,335 points to end at 60,612 on Monday, while the broader Nifty 50 surged 383 points to end at 18,053. HDFC and HDFC Bank, which surged over 9% each following their merger announcement, were the top Sensex gainers. With Sensex reclaiming 60,000-mark on Monday, investors' wealth has increased by ₹30 lakh crore in nearly a month.

144.title: Sharvari to star alongside Aamir Khan's son Junaid in Yash Raj's next: Reports
144.article_body: Actress Sharvari Wagh will reportedly star alongside Aamir Khan's son Junaid Khan in Siddharth P Malhotra's directorial venture, 'Maharaja'. When asked about it, Sharvari said, "I have a film with Yash Raj that will hopefully release this year." Sharvari revealed she's drawn towards historical dramas. "History intrigues me. I want to do movies that blend mythology and history," she added.

145.title: Sri Lankan President sacks brother & Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa amid crisis
145.article_body: A day after all 26 Cabinet Ministers of Sri Lanka resigned, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa sacked his brother and Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa amid the country's worst economic crisis. Basil had negotiated the Indian economic relief package to help Sri Lanka tackle the foreign exchange crisis. He has now been replaced by Ali Sabry, who was the Justice Minister till Sunday.

146.title: As son grows older, he acquires father's business: Parekh on HDFC-HDFC Bank merger
146.article_body: After HDFC announced that it'll merge itself with HDFC Bank, its Chairman Deepak Parekh said, "It's a merger of equals. It's a friendly...not at all hostile. And, we are one." "As the son grows old, he acquires the father's business...That's all happening here, nothing more," Parekh added. HDFC was founded in 1977, while HDFC Bank was set up in 1994.

147.title: Mika abuses journo who asked if Rakhi will be part of his Swayamvar
147.article_body: Singer Mika Singh, who will be looking for a bride in upcoming show 'Swayamvar - Mika Di Vohti', abused and insulted a journalist who asked him if Rakhi Sawant will be a part of the show, reported SpotboyE. As per the report, the journalist asked him the question at a press meet and Mika later insulted him in a room.

148.title: I would really like to explore B'wood scene while I'm here: Matteo Bocelli
148.article_body: Italian opera singer Andrea Bocelli's son Matteo Bocelli, who's in India, has said he's "delighted to be here". He's collaborating with Amaal Mallik and Prakriti and Sukriti Kakar for a new song. When asked if he knows anything about Indian music, Matteo said, "Not as much as I'd like! I'd really like to explore the Bollywood scene while I'm here."

149.title: Bishnoi accepts challenges, not afraid to bowl to big batters: Jaffer
149.article_body: Talking about Lucknow Super Giants spinner Ravi Bishnoi, ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer opined that the bowler accepts challenges and is not afraid to bowl to "big batters". "Bishnoi has a great temperament...Even if he gets hit, you can expect him to make a comeback," Jaffer added. In the ongoing IPL 2022, Bishnoi has picked up two wickets in two matches.

150.title: Gurugram civic body prepares plan to decongest Sadar Bazar
150.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Gurugram (MCG) has prepared a plan to reduce congestion in Sadar Bazar. One of the measures in the plan aims to reduce the number of street vendors in the market, with shopkeepers allowing them to operate facing a ₹5,000 fine. A shopkeeper violating the rule for third time will have his shop sealed, an official said.

151.title: I learnt one scene for 1.5 years, coloured my hair 4 times: Alia on 'RRR'
151.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt said that she learnt one scene for one and a half years for the first time for the movie 'RRR' because of the COVID-19 lockdown. "My hair colour was...in continuity for another film...I had to...have darker hair...So I coloured hair, but...highlights were still visible," she said, while mentioning that she had to colour her hair four times.

152.title: Indian-American producer Joseph Patel's film wins Best Music Film at Grammys
152.article_body: Indian-American producer Joseph Patel's 'Summer of Soul' bagged a Grammy in the Best Music Film category on Sunday. It also won the Best Documentary Feature at the Oscars this year. The film, 'Summer Of Soul' is directed by Ahmir Thompson who is known by his stage name Questlove. Joseph backed the movie along with producers Robert Fyvolent and David Dinerstein.

153.title: We're lucky to have Dhoni’s experience, guidance: CSK skipper Jadeja
153.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said his side is lucky to have MS Dhoni's experience and guidance. "We don't have to look far for advice...We have his experience to rely on in the dressing room," Jadeja added. Speaking about three consecutive losses in the ongoing IPL 2022, Jadeja stated, "In T20 cricket, it's...matter of one match. One win can change things."

154.title: Mumbai metro faces technical glitch 2 days after inauguration
154.article_body: Mumbai metro's Dahisar East-Andheri East metro corridor was hit with a technical glitch on Monday, two days after the service was inaugurated. "Due to technical error, train at Magathane towards Aarey has been withdrawn from service," Maha Mumbai Metro Operation Corporation Limited (MMMOCL) tweeted. On the Dahisar East-Andheri East corridor, trains currently operate between Aarey and Dahisar East.

155.title: 55,000 people travel on new Mumbai Metro lines 2A & 7 on 2nd day
155.article_body: As many as 55,000 people travelled on the newly-inaugurated Mumbai Metro lines 2A and 7 on the second day of operations on Sunday. Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray had flagged off both the lines on Saturday. An official said that while there was no rush in the day, the Metro started getting crowded on Sunday evening.

156.title: Russia claims video of bodies in Ukraine's Bucha 'ordered to blame it'
156.article_body: Russian foreign ministry spokesperson claimed on Sunday that the footage of Ukraine's Bucha was released in a plot to blame Russia. The spokesperson was referring to the video of dead bodies lying on Bucha's streets. The spokesperson also said that West's statements, "made in the first minute" after the footage appeared, "leaves no doubt as to who 'ordered' this story".

157.title: Shein's valuation would top H&M and Zara combined with $1 billion funding
157.article_body: Chinese fashion e-commerce startup Shein is in talks to raise $1 billion and could do so at a valuation that would be more than the combined worth of H&M and Zara. Shein is seeking a valuation of about $100 billion, Bloomberg reported. Following the funding, Shein would become the world’s most-valuable startup after ByteDance and SpaceX, as per CB Insights.

158.title: We've seen how Dhoni has won such matches: RP Singh on CSK's 54-run loss
158.article_body: Following CSK's 54-run loss against PBKS in IPL 2022, RP Singh said everyone has seen in the past how MS Dhoni has won such matches for his side. "Anything is possible when Dhoni is at...crease," he added. Chasing 181 to win, CSK were reduced to 36/5 when Dhoni (23) joined Shivam Dube (57). They stitched a 62-run sixth wicket partnership.

159.title: AR Rahman, son Ameen meet BTS at Grammy Awards; Ameen shares pics
159.article_body: Music composer AR Rahman attended 64th Annual Grammy Awards at MGM Grand Garden Arena in Las Vegas with his son, AR Ameen. Taking to Instagram, Ameen shared some pictures where he and his father are seen posing with the members of South Korean boy band BTS. Reacting to his post, a fan wrote, "Ask BTS to collab with your dad."

160.title: 40 booked for pelting stones during clash between 2 communities in K'taka
160.article_body: At least 40 unidentified persons have been booked over a clash near a mosque in a village in Karnataka's Raichur district on Sunday. Police said some Hindu persons were playing Holi around the mosque when members of the Muslim community objected to this, which led to a clash. Both the sides pelted stones and exchanged profanities, according to police.

161.title: Pune man arrested for selling over 500 jeans with fake labels of a brand
161.article_body: A shopkeeper has been arrested by the Pimpri-Chinchwad Police for allegedly selling 512 duplicate jeans with fake labels of a brand. The 26-year-old accused person is a resident of Morwadi and runs a garments shop in Pimpri. Police have registered an FIR against him under relevant sections of the Copyright Act, 1957.

162.title: Climate change activists block oil facility near London airport
162.article_body: About 30 climate change activists from the Extinction Rebellion group claimed to have blocked the entrance of an oil facility near London's Heathrow Airport on Monday. The blocking of the Esso West oil facility was part of a nationwide campaign to force the government to limit the use of fossil fuels. "Climate action cannot wait," said an activist.

163.title: Ram Charan surprises fans at Mumbai theatre, gets mobbed; pics surface
163.article_body: Actor Ram Charan surprised his fans when he visited a Mumbai theatre on Sunday. Reports said fans went crazy as soon as he stepped out of car and wanted to take a picture with him. Ram Charan, who is scheduled to visit Sabarimala Temple, was spotted barefoot at theatre. In pictures that have surfaced, he can be seen greeting fans.

164.title: Businessman, friend robbed at gunpoint in Delhi's Shahadra
164.article_body: A businessman and his friend were allegedly robbed at gunpoint when the duo were walking towards the Yamuna Sports Complex in Delhi on Sunday. The businessman, 29, alleged that two bike-borne men came and threatened him with a pistol and fled with his gold bracelet, the Deputy Commissioner of Police (Shahdara) R Sathiyasundaram said.

165.title: HDFC Bank-HDFC merger may create India's 2nd-largest company, beating TCS
165.article_body: HDFC and HDFC Bank saw their combined market capitalisation surpass that of India's second-most valued company, TCS, on Monday. Following the announcement that HDFC will merge itself with HDFC Bank, both stocks surged over 9% each during intraday trade. At around 2:30 pm, HDFC Bank's market value stood above ₹9.1 lakh crore, while HDFC's m-cap was at ₹4.80 lakh crore.

166.title: Divine becomes first homegrown Indian hip hop star to attend Grammys, shares pics
166.article_body: Rapper Divine has become the first homegrown Indian hip hop star to attend the Grammy Awards. Sharing pictures from Grammys on Instagram, Divine wrote, "Rap royalty." In an official statement about his Grammys debut, Divine said, "Surreal to be at the Grammys with among some of the best in the world!"

167.title: I'll keep only 1% of my earnings: FTX's 30-yr-old crypto billionaire worth $20 bn
167.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old CEO of the world's third-largest crypto exchange FTX, told Bloomberg that he'll "keep enough money to maintain a comfortable life: 1% of his earnings or, at minimum, $100,000 a year." Bloomberg added, "Other than that, he plans to give it all away—every dollar, or Bitcoin." Sam Bankman-Fried has a net worth of over $20 billion.

168.title: After 45 years, we have found a home within our own family: HDFC Chairman
168.article_body: After announcing the merger of HDFC with HDFC Bank, Chairman Deepak Parekh said he spent "two sleepless nights" prior to the development. "After 45 years of housing finance and 9 million homes provided to Indians, we had to find a home for ourselves. We have found it within our own family and in our own bank," Parekh further said.

169.title: 30-yr-old crypto billionaire drives Corolla, sleeps on bean bag & has 10 roommates
169.article_body: Sam Bankman-Fried, the 30-year-old CEO of the world's third-largest crypto exchange FTX, "lives like a college student", sleeps on a bean bag and drives a Toyota Corolla, Bloomberg reported. "When he's not at the office, he crashes at an apartment with 10 roommates, though it's a penthouse," Bloomberg added. Sam, worth over $20 billion, is currently living in the Bahamas.

170.title: I hate talking on phone: Ajay Devgn on constantly changing number
170.article_body: Ajay Devgn has revealed that he is constantly changing his number, adding he hates talking on the phone. He further said he doesn't like to speak unless it's necessary. As per a report, Preity Zinta and Priyanka Chopra also keep changing their phone numbers. However, Aishwarya Rai, Kareena Kapoor and Akshay Kumar have reportedly had the same number for years.

171.title: 18-yr-old boy drowns while swimming with friends in Pune's Khadakwasla dam
171.article_body: An 18-year-old boy drowned while swimming with his friends in the Khadakwasla dam in Pune on Sunday, police said. The fire brigade rescuers were called and his body was fished out later, the police added. The boy, who was from Ahmednagar, had gone to the dam for a picnic with his friends.

172.title: SRH can't change the auction, but need to play better now: Jaffer
172.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said SRH can't change what happened at the auction but captain Kane Williamson can get better performances out of his players in their upcoming matches. "SRH were tactically poor (against RR), sent Pooran ahead of Markram, didn't bowl Washington much," Jaffer explained. SRH lost their first game against RR by 61 runs.

173.title: Rahul shares chart comparing cost of full tank of fuel in vehicles in 2014 & now
173.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has shared a chart comparing the cost of a full tank of fuel in different vehicles in 2014 and now. According to him, it costed ₹714 for a full tank of fuel in a bike, compared to ₹1,038 now. It costed ₹2,856 for a full tank of fuel in car in 2014, compared to ₹4,152 now.

174.title: Rather than blocking, I mute Instagram accounts to avoid negativity: Ananya
174.article_body: In an interview, actress Ananya Panday was asked whether her relationship with social media has changed over the years, to which she replied, "Because of my recent discovery of the mute feature on Instagram, I choose what I want to see and absorb." Ananya added that she uses the "mute" feature instead of "blocking or unfollowing" someone to avoid negativity.

175.title: UP CM suspends SDM accused of beating clerk to death in Pratapgarh
175.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday suspended Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Gyanendra Singh after he, along with four others, was booked for beating a 57-year-old tehsil clerk to death in Pratapgarh. No arrests have reportedly been made in the case so far. According to the post-mortem, the victim died of "septicaemic shock due to ante mortem lung infection".
