176.title: 24-yr-old Punjab man missing since April 2 dies of drug overdose, 3 held
176.article_body: Three people were arrested after a 24-year-old man, Sanpreet Singh, who worked at a hospital in Punjab's Ludhiana died due to drug overdose, reports said. Sanpreet's father said his son had left home on Saturday but did not return home, following which, he was spotted with those arrested. Sanpreet was later found unconscious and hospital declared him dead on arrival.

177.title: Bengaluru reports zero new COVID-19 deaths for 3 consecutive days
177.article_body: Bengaluru has reported zero new coronavirus deaths for three days consecutively, according to official data for Sunday. The city also recorded 49 new coronavirus cases with a positivity rate of 1.2% on the same day, the data showed. The total number of new vaccinations was 6,937, while tests done were 4,080, the data also showed.

178.title: Rohit would've led Deccan Chargers had it not been for auction: Ojha
178.article_body: Former India spinner Pragyan Ojha has revealed that Deccan Chargers captain Adam Gilchrist had identified Rohit Sharma as his successor at the franchise. "Had there been no auction after the third season, then probably Rohit would have led the Deccan Chargers side before leading the Mumbai Indians team. Because Gilchrist had already said 'Rohit is ready now'," stated Ojha.

179.title: Sonam Kapoor flaunts baby bump in new pics; fan calls her a 'Stunning mom'
179.article_body: Actress Sonam Kapoor shared new pictures on Instagram, where she can be seen flaunting her baby bump. She donned her mother Sunita Kapoor's white satin saree with a sleeveless bralette blouse alongside a long necklace with statement earrings. Sharing the photos, Sonam wrote, "Last night for...@abujani1's birthday evening." One of the fans commented on her post, and wrote, "Stunning mom."

180.title: University students write to Maha CM, object against offline exams
180.article_body: Several students of various Maharashtra-based universities have written to CM Uddhav Thackeray to conduct the upcoming summer examinations in online mode. The students have even launched a Twitter campaign, especially after some of the state-run universities decided to conduct offline exams by terming online exams a "temporary arrangement". "We are not prepared for offline exams," a student said.

181.title: Punjab man killed as jeep hits scooter after ramming into golgappa cart
181.article_body: One man was crushed to death and his wife was injured after a jeep hit their scooter in Punjab's Ludhiana. Reports said that the jeep was trying to run away after ramming into a golgappa cart and injuring the vendor. The man died on the spot while his wife was rushed to the hospital and suffered multiple injuries, including fractures.

182.title: TMC's Derek O'Brien pushes for Women's Reservation Bill in RS
182.article_body: TMC's Derek O'Brien submitted a notice under Rule 168 in the Rajya Sabha for introduction of the Women's Reservation Bill this week in Parliament. "Open dare to the government. Introduce the long-pending Women Reservation Bill in Rajya Sabha this week (before April 8). Accept and put to vote motion under Rule," O'Brien tweeted.

183.title: Olivia Rodrigo mistakenly drops and breaks her Grammy Award, her reaction goes viral
183.article_body: US' 19-year-old singer-songwriter Olivia Rodrigo, who won three awards at Grammys 2022, mistakenly dropped and broke one of the trophies in the press room. Olivia looked stunned as the trophy broke, with her reaction going viral. Olivia won Grammy for 'Best New Artist', 'Best Pop Vocal Album' for 'Sour' and 'Best Pop Solo Performances' for her hit 'Drivers License'.

184.title: 10-year-old Manipur girl attends school with 2-year-old sister in lap, pic goes viral
184.article_body: A photo of a 10-year-old Manipuri girl attending school with her 2-year-old sister in her lap has gone viral online. The Class 4 girl, Meiningsinliu Pamei, was babysitting her sister as their parents were out for farming. Manipur minister Biswajit Singh tweeted, "Her dedication for education is what left me amazed!", adding he'll take care of her education till graduation.

185.title: Rajya Sabha faces 2nd adjournment amid Opposition ruckus over price hike
185.article_body: The Rajya Sabha on Monday faced a second consecutive adjournment till 2 pm following the ruckus created by the Opposition parties against rising prices of petroleum products and essential commodities across India. The House was adjourned a few minutes after it assembled at noon today following a similar adjournment over the issue.

186.title: Khushi Kapoor wishes Varun's niece Anjini Dhawan on b'day, shares pic
186.article_body: Boney Kapoor's daughter Khushi Kapoor took to her Instagram Stories to wish actor Varun Dhawan's niece Anjini Dhawan on her birthday. She shared a picture of herself with Anjini and wrote, "Happy birthday to my heart Anjini Dhawan." Khushi will make her Bollywood debut with Zoya Akhtar's upcoming live-action musical film based on Archie Comics.

187.title: 2 Kerala fire officials suspended, 3 shifted for training PFI team
187.article_body: The Kerala government suspended two fire safety officials and transferred three others for training rescue and relief team of Popular Front of India (PFI) workers in Aluva in Ernakulam district. A circular from the office of CM Pinarayi Vijayan said that the government viewed the incident seriously. The regional and district fire officers, Ernakulam, have been suspended on pending enquiry.

188.title: Serious offence but Ashish Mishra not a flight risk: UP govt to SC
188.article_body: The UP government on Monday told the Supreme Court that while the "alleged offences are serious", Ashish Mishra, accused in farmers' killings in Lakhimpur Kheri, is not a flight risk. The apex court, which was hearing a plea seeking cancellation of bail granted to Mishra, MoS Ajay Mishra Teni's son, has reserved its order.

189.title: Mumbai man gets 3-yr jail term for groping 13-yr-old girl inside building lift
189.article_body: A 27-year-old man has been sentenced to three years of rigorous imprisonment for groping his 13-year-old neighbour inside their building's lift in Mumbai, in 2015. A fine of ₹10,000 has also been imposed on him, which is to be given to the minor girl as compensation. The girl shared the incident with her school friend, who then informed the principal.

190.title: Please try and help: Sri Lankan Opposition leader to PM Modi
190.article_body: Sri Lankan Opposition leader Sajith Premadasa while speaking to ANI on Monday requested PM Narendra Modi to please try and help the country "to the maximum possible extent". He also called the resignation of the country's 26 Cabinet Ministers amid the economic crisis a "melodrama to fool people". The resignations aren't a "genuine effort" to bring people relief, he said.

191.title: Sheldon Jackson has got an MS Dhoni sort of a feel: KKR coach McCullum
191.article_body: KKR head coach Brendon McCullum has praised Sheldon Jackson for his wicketkeeping skills, stating that the 35-year-old has got "an MS Dhoni sort of a feel". McCullum added, "Jackson's wicketkeeping skills have been superb...really fast hands." Sheldon was dropped from KKR's playing XI for their third game against PBKS after he scored 3 runs in the first two games.

192.title: One of biggest EV rallies ever conducted at Pune conclave: Aaditya
192.article_body: Maharashtra minister Aaditya Thackeray on Sunday tweeted that 400 electric vehicles (EVs), including two, three and four-wheelers participated in the EV rally at the Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave. He said that this makes it "one of the biggest EV rallies ever conducted". "This showcases Maharashtra's encouraging transition to clean mobility for long term, sustainable development," he added.

193.title: IMD predicts severe heatwave conditions in Delhi this week
193.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted severe heatwave conditions in Delhi this week. "By Wednesday, Delhi will...see calm conditions and clear skies, leading to mercury touching or crossing the 40°C-mark in most places," weather scientist RK Jenamani said. "No rain is expected in the first and second weeks of April. Therefore, temperatures are expected to rebound," he added.

194.title: Cardi B deletes Twitter account during Grammys 2022, calls her fan base 'f*****g dumba**'
194.article_body: American rapper Cardi B deleted her Twitter account during the Grammy Awards 2022 ceremony after being criticised by her fan base for not attending the event. Before deleting the account, she tweeted, "I hate this f*****g dumb*** fan base. You got the slow dumba***s dragging my kids all cause y'all thought I was going to...Grammys and I didn't the f**k?"

195.title: Prize money for all 8 teams at 2022 Women's World Cup revealed
195.article_body: Winners Australia received a total prize money of $1,495,000, which includes $175,000 for winning all their seven group stage matches and $1,320,000 for winning the tournament. Runners-up England won $700,000, while losing semi-finalists South Africa and West Indies received $437,500 and $387,500 respectively. India got $145,000 from the total prize money pool of $3.5 million.

196.title: Kanye wins two Grammys despite being banned from performing at the ceremony
196.article_body: Rapper Kanye West won two awards at the 2022 Grammys despite being banned from performing at the event. He won Best Rap Song for his track 'Jail'  as well as the Best Melodic Rap Performance for 'Hurricane'. The cancellation of his performance happened due to his troubling social media posts, which allegedly included harassing ex-wife Kim Kardashian's boyfriend Pete Davidson.

197.title: Actors Debina Bonnerjee, Gurmeet Choudhary blessed with a baby girl, share video
197.article_body: Actors Debina Bonnerjee and Gurmeet Choudhary have been blessed with a baby girl. The couple shared a video showing the hand of the newborn, writing, "With utmost gratitude we welcome our 'baby girl' into this world. 3.4.2022...Thank you for all your love and blessings." The duo are already parents to daughters Pooja and Lata, whom they had adopted in 2017.

198.title: Silly goose: Khloe Kardashian to user who accused her of having butt implants
198.article_body: American television personality Khloe Kardashian replied to an Instagram user who accused her of having butt implants in the comment section of her workout video. "You can see...implants when stretching. A second layer of her bum on top of her bum," the user wrote. "Lol, silly goose. It's...seam design of...leggings. You guys just want to believe anything bad," Khloe responded.

199.title: Told mom I'd win Grammy when I was 9, she thought it was kid pipe dream: Olivia
199.article_body: American singer-songwriter Olivia Rodrigo, who attended her first-ever Grammys and won three trophies after being nominated in seven categories, said that she had told her mother that she would win a Grammy award when she was nine years old. "She was very supportive even though I'm sure she thought it was just a little-kid pipe dream," she added.

200.title: Gangster's father attempts self-immolation at Punjab police station
200.article_body: A gangster's father suffered 30% burns after he attempted self-immolation outside a police station in Punjab's Ludhiana on Sunday over his son being shot. A shopkeeper had shot the gangster last year when the latter allegedly tried to extort money. The father claimed that police were reluctant to take action against the shopkeeper. Police officers had immediately doused the fire.

201.title: Sri Lanka’s central bank Governor resigns amid economic crisis
201.article_body: Sri Lanka's central bank Governor Ajith Nivard Cabraal on Monday resigned from his post amid the economic crisis the country is facing. "In the context of all Cabinet Ministers resigning, I have today submitted my resignation as Governor," he said in a Twitter post. Earlier, several ministers, including the prime minister's son, resigned from the Cabinet.

202.title: Imran Khan names US diplomat who sent 'threatening message' to him
202.article_body: Pakistan PM Imran Khan has revealed that Assistant Secretary of State for South and Central Asian Affairs Donald Lu had sent a threatening message to him through Pakistan's Ambassador Asad Majeed. Khan claimed that Lu warned Majeed there would be implications if the Pakistan PM survived the no-confidence vote. Khan added that the no-trust motion against him was a "conspiracy".

203.title: Uttarakhand deploys 3 shooters to hunt man-eater tiger in Nainital
203.article_body: The state forest department has hired three shooters to hunt down a man-eater tiger that has killed six people in the past three months in Uttarakhand's Nainital district. "Three teams have also been deployed to tranquillise the tiger," said CS Joshi, DFO, Ramnagar forest division, Nainital. Notably, the three hunters are Ashish Das Gupta, Kirnesh Jung and Sayyad Ali Hadi.

204.title: Jagan Mohan Reddy inaugurates 13 new districts of Andhra Pradesh
204.article_body: Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy inaugurated 13 new districts in the state via video conferencing on Monday, taking the total number of districts in the state to 26. Reddy said the creation of more districts is a key step towards decentralised development of all regions. "There will be better governance, peace, security and transparency," the CM added.

205.title: Govt is not realising that country is under inflation: Mallikarjun Kharge
205.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Monday said that the government is not realising that the country is under inflation. "We will raise the issue in the House. Other political parties will also raise the issue, including the hike in fuel prices," Kharge added. Earlier, Kharge said the hike in fuel prices directly affects the cost of all other commodities.

206.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi, to now cost ₹64.11 per kg
206.article_body: The Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) has hiked the price of Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg from Monday. CNG will now cost ₹64.11 per kg in the national capital. "In view of the CNG price hike, we are not in favour of switching on the cab's air conditioner for passengers," a city-based cab driver told ANI.

207.title: AAP can’t dare to look at Haryana: CM Manohar Lal Khattar
207.article_body: Reacting to AAP-led Punjab government's resolution seeking immediate transfer of Chandigarh to Punjab, Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar said AAP has double standards. "Despite being in rule for a few days (in Punjab), they have raised the controversial issue of Chandigarh. I feel they are doing so on someone else's commands...They can't dare to even look at Haryana," Khattar added.

208.title: IAS officer dances to 'Nagada Sang Dhol' with Kerala students, video viral
208.article_body: In a video that has gone viral on social media, IAS officer and Pathanamthitta District Collector Divya Iyer can be seen dancing to the song 'Nagada Sang Dhol' along with students during a flash mob in Kerala. The performance happened during an event that was organised in the district stadium for the announcement of "Mahatma Gandhi University Art Festival".

209.title: Scenes from horror movie: Ukraine official on bodies on town roads
209.article_body: Ukrainian Presidential Advisor Oleksiy Arestovych on Sunday said that the dead civilian bodies seen lying on streets in towns near Kyiv after the withdrawal of some Russian troops were like "scenes from a horror movie". This comes as the country's authorities accused Russia of war crimes. Earlier, Mayor of Bucha said that 280 people were buried in a mass grave.

210.title: UN chief calls for probe into mass killings in Ukraine’s Bucha
210.article_body: UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for an independent probe into the mass killings of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha after pictures of bodies strewn on streets surfaced. "I am deeply shocked by the images of civilians killed in Bucha, Ukraine," he said. UN official Osnat Lubrani said Ukrainians have been enduring a living hell for more than a month.

211.title: Justin, Hailey Bieber attend Grammys 2022 post her health scare; pics surface
211.article_body: Hailey Bieber attended the 2022 Grammy Awards alongside her husband-singer Justin Bieber, less than a month after being hospitalised due to a blood clot in her brain. The couple shared a kiss as they made a red carpet appearance. Several pictures of the duo have surfaced online, where Justin donned an oversized suit jacket, while Hailey wore a strapless gown.

212.title: 7 houseboats gutted in fire at Srinagar’s Nigeen Lake
212.article_body: Seven houseboats were destroyed in a fire that broke out at the Nigeen Lake in Srinagar in the early hours of Monday. The fire broke out on one of the houseboats anchored at the rear side of the Nigeen Club on the lake and quickly spread to adjacent houseboats. There was no loss of life in the incident, officials said.

213.title: AR Rahman attends Grammys 2022 with his son Ameen, shares pics
213.article_body: Two-time Grammy Award-winner, music composer AR Rahman, attended the Grammy Awards 2022 with his son AR Ameen. Rahman shared a selfie while seated beside his son during the Grammys ceremony, while in another picture captioned "Parenting", Rahman can be seen gracing the red carpet of the event with his son. Ameen also shared pictures of himself with BTS members.

214.title: 52.7% Chandigarh residents unaware of cybercrimes: Survey
214.article_body: According to a two-month-long survey conducted by the Chandigarh Cyber Crime Investigation Cell, at least 52.7% of the residents lack knowledge about the various kinds of cybercrimes. About 80% of participants received fraud messages/calls and 20.3% of them preferred to report to the police, as per the survey. Exactly 57.9% of them preferred to ignore the calls/messages.

215.title: 7th edition of 'Musicathon' to be held in Bir on April 15th and 16th
215.article_body: The seventh edition of Musicathon will be held in Himachal Pradesh's Bir on April 15th and 16th. "With the most outstanding location and ultra talented indie artists, we are ready to celebrate art, music, love, people and nature..with you all!" a post on Musicathon's official Instagram page said. The Instagram post also featured pictures of the performers.

216.title: Satellite pics show 45-foot trench at Ukraine church, site of mass grave
216.article_body: Satellite images show a 45-foot-long trench dug into the grounds of a Ukrainian church where a mass grave was found this week after Russian forces withdrew from the town of Bucha, Maxar Technologies, a private US company said. Ukraine accused Russian forces of carrying out a "massacre" in the town. Russia denied the allegations, calling them a "provocation" by Ukraine.

217.title: Been a lot of healing, coming to normalcy; hoping work will happen soon: Rhea
217.article_body: Actress Rhea Chakraborty said that it has been a lot of healing and coming back to normalcy for her during the COVID-19 lockdown. "So other than that, like work I'm trying, I'm hoping something will happen soon. So fingers crossed," she said. While talking about returning to ramp walking, she said, "I am happy to be back at it."

218.title: Kejriwal’s dreams to progress in other states will be crushed: Union Minister
218.article_body: Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said AAP's Arvind Kejriwal will be taught such a lesson in Gujarat that his dreams to progress in other states of the country will be "crushed". His remark came after Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann visited Gujarat in the run-up to Assembly polls in the state later this year.

219.title: 11 in-laws of Gujarat nurse booked for torturing her, abetting her suicide
219.article_body: Eleven persons have been booked for allegedly abetting the suicide of a 29-year-old nurse, an employee of Mansa Civil Hospital, in Gujarat's Gandhinagar. Police have recovered a suicide note in which she named 11 of her in-laws, excluding her husband, for allegedly mentally and physically torturing her. The nurse's body was found under mysterious circumstances by some neighbours, police said.

220.title: TN lifts COVID-19 curbs; vaccination no longer compulsory to visit public places
220.article_body: In view of the improving COVID-19 situation, the Tamil Nadu government on Sunday lifted all restrictions in the state and also announced that vaccination against coronavirus is no longer compulsory to visit public places. The state government has advised citizens to continue following COVID-19-appropriate behaviour like maintaining social distance, wearing face masks and washing hands.

221.title: CSK will continue to back Ruturaj Gaikwad: Ravindra Jadeja
221.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja has said they'll continue to back Ruturaj Gaikwad in their upcoming games in the IPL season. "We need to give him confidence...we all know that he's a good player...and I'm sure he'll come good," stated Jadeja. Ruturaj, who had scored 635 runs last season, has scored 0, 1 and 1 so far this season.

222.title: 'Mastermind' behind UP board Class 12 English paper leak arrested
222.article_body: The alleged mastermind behind the UP board Class 12 English paper leak was arrested by Ballia Police on Sunday. Nirbhay Narayan Singh apparently got the paper solved and sold the copies for up to ₹30,000 per student. "It was a difficult case...because the footprint of transactions on social media platforms and digital transactions were difficult to trace," Ballia SP said.

223.title: One arrested for 46-yr-old's murder over drainage dispute in MP
223.article_body: One person has been arrested in connection with the murder of a 46-year-old person over a drainage lane dispute in Madhya Pradesh's Guna. Police said the suspect, identified as 32-year-old Virendra Ahirwar, was detained within two hours after they got information about the murder. The victim was found dead in his house on the intervening night of Saturday and Sunday.

224.title: Kartik Aaryan flies to Mauritius for 'Shehzada' shoot
224.article_body: Actor Kartik Aaryan has landed in Mauritius to shoot for his upcoming film 'Shehzada'. He took to his Instagram Stories to share some pictures and videos from Mauritius. The film is the Hindi remake of Allu Arjun-starrer Telugu film 'Ala Vaikunthapurramuloo'. Directed by Rohit Dhawan, 'Shehzada' also stars Kriti Sanon, Manisha Koirala and Paresh Rawal.

225.title: 80 from Haryana complain of diarrhoea, nausea after eating Kuttu flour
225.article_body: 80 people from Haryana's Ambala, Yamunanagar and Karnal districts fell ill after they reportedly consumed food prepared from "kuttu" [buckwheat] flour. At least 49 people from Ambala Cantonment complained of diarrhoea and nausea and were admitted to hospital. Five people from Yamunanagar experienced similar problems. 25 people from Karnal complained of vomiting and loss of consciousness.

226.title: Actress Mohena Kumari Singh shares pictures from her baby shower
226.article_body: Actress-choreographer Mohena Kumari Singh's friends recently threw a 'surprise baby shower' for her. The 'Yeh Rishta Kya Kehlata Hai' actress, who's expecting her first child with husband Suyesh Rawat, shared a few pictures from her baby shower on her Instagram handle. "Thankful and grateful for all the love and blessings," Mohena captioned the post.

227.title: Pope pays tribute to journalists killed in war-torn Ukraine
227.article_body: Pope Francis on Sunday paid tribute to journalists killed in the war-torn Ukraine since Russia's attack. Talking to journalists, he said, "Your job is a job for the common good. They have fallen in service of the common good of information. Let's not forget that they were courageous. I pray for them, I pray that the Lord rewards their work."

228.title: People of Gujarat are frustrated, waiting for honest party: AAP Gujarat chief
228.article_body: AAP Gujarat President Gopal Italia said that the people of the state are "frustrated" and are waiting for an honest party. With the arrival of both AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, the hopes of the people have increased, Italia added. "BJP government has done nothing in all these years," Italia stated.

229.title: Grammys' 'In Memoriam' section fails to pay tribute to Lata Mangeshkar during ceremony
229.article_body: After the Oscars, the Grammy Awards also omitted late legendary Indian singer Lata Mangeshkar in the 'In Memoriam' section during the ceremony. "So both the Oscars and the Grammys failed to honor the late great Lata Mangeshkar in their respective memoriam segments? That’s a shame," a user tweeted. "Disappointed but not surprised," another user wrote.

230.title: 46 arrested, 7 detained for questioning over stone-pelting incident in Rajasthan
230.article_body: Rajasthan Police has arrested 46 people and detained seven others for interrogation in connection with incidents of stone-pelting and arson during a religious procession in Karauli on Saturday. Police have also seized 21 two-wheeler and four-wheeler vehicles. "The situation is under control but a curfew has been imposed in the city as a precautionary measure," Bharatpur Range IGP said.

231.title: They won't panic: Sam Curran on CSK suffering 3 straight defeats in IPL 2022
231.article_body: Former CSK all-rounder Sam Curran has admitted that it's a tricky situation for CSK after having lost their first three games in a row this IPL season. He, however, also added that the CSK management won't panic. "Having experienced the dressing room there, the coaches, the management, it's a very calm environment there...[they] know how the IPL works," he stated.

232.title: Arooj wins Grammy for her song 'Mohabbat', becomes 1st Pakistani woman to win the award
232.article_body: Vocalist-music composer Arooj Aftab has become the first Pakistani woman to win a Grammy award. Arooj won the 'Best Global Music Performance' award at 2022 Grammys for her song 'Mohabbat'. "I think I am going to faint. Wow...thank you so much. I feel like this category in and of itself has been so insane," she said in her acceptance speech.

233.title: Duped strangers for ₹50 lakh as my aunt had cancer: 'Lock Upp' contestant Azma
233.article_body: 'Lock Upp' contestant Azma Fallah revealed she duped many strangers while working for a social media app that required her to befriend people and entertain them with her chats. "I duped strangers, [for] about 40-50 lakhs...[but] I wouldn't get...entire amount," she said. "My aunt was diagnosed with cancer. I'd either lie or say the truth and get money," she added.

234.title: Narsinghanand booked for hate speech at 'mahapanchayat' in Delhi
234.article_body: Police have booked religious leader Yati Narsinghanand along with several speakers and organisers over alleged hate speeches at the 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' held in Delhi's Burari on Sunday. Narsinghanand had reportedly urged Hindus to take up arms, claiming that "50% of Hindus will convert" if a Muslim becomes PM. Sudarshan News Chief Editor Suresh Chavhanke was among those who've been booked.

235.title: Hong Kong leader Carrie Lam says won't seek second term
235.article_body: Hong Kong's Chief Executive Carrie Lam on Monday said that she would not seek a second term in office in order to focus on family. "There's only one consideration and that is family. I have told everyone before that family is my first priority in terms of my consideration. They think it's time for me to go home," said Lam.

236.title: 3 held for carrying out contract killing of businessman in Delhi
236.article_body: Three men, aged between 22 and 30, were arrested for allegedly murdering a businessman (37) as part of their contract killing in Delhi's Welcome area. The three accused were hired by a duo to take revenge for the latter's brother's death from the victim, police said. The accused were promised ₹3 lakh for carrying out the killing, police said.

237.title: 4 held with illegal weapons in Mohali, links with gangsters being probed
237.article_body: The Kharar Police in Mohali arrested four persons with two unlicensed pistols and live cartridges. The police are investigating the links of the arrested persons with gangsters. The arrests were made on the basis of specific information that some people were entering Kharar with illegal weapons. The police registered a case under relevant sections of the Arms Act.

238.title: Banks force you to travel to the home branch for everything: Jupiter
238.article_body: People face a lot of trouble due to the rules of some banks, said Jupiter, a 100%* digital banking app, adding that people have to take leaves from work or they end up wasting their weekend just doing bank work. Tired of such routines, Jupiter promises to be a banking partner for millennials and offers a 100%* digital banking experience.

239.title: Imran Khan to stay PM till caretaker PM is appointed: Pakistan's President
239.article_body: Imran Khan will remain in office as Pakistan's Prime Minister till a caretaker Prime Minister is appointed, Pakistan's President Arif Alvi clarified in a late-night tweet. This comes after Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) chairman Imran Khan was de-notified as the Prime Minister of Pakistan. Earlier, Deputy Speaker of the National Assembly Qasim Suri dismissed the no-confidence motion against Khan.

240.title: If a Muslim becomes PM, 40% Hindus will be killed: Yati Narsinghanand
240.article_body: The head priest of Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi Temple, Yati Narsinghanand said that once a Muslim becomes the Prime Minister of India, 50 per cent Hindus will convert and 40 per cent will be killed. "Remaining 10 per cent will either live in refugee camps or in other countries in...next 20 years...This will be the future of the Hindus," he added.

241.title: Man tries to enter Gorakhnath Temple in UP raising slogans, injures 2 policemen
241.article_body: A 29-year-old man armed with a sharp-edged weapon on Sunday night allegedly tried to enter the Gorakhnath Temple premises in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur forcefully and injured two policemen deployed there. Police said the man, who also sustained injuries while being overpowered by security personnel, had allegedly raised religious slogans. The motive behind the incident is yet to be ascertained.

242.title: Wave Group flat buyers protest over delay in delivery in Noida
242.article_body: Over 50 homebuyers of Wave Group's Amore apartments in Noida Sector 32 staged a protest over the delay in delivery of flats on Saturday. They raised slogans against the builder's officials. The Wave Group had reportedly promised to deliver flats by 2016. "Out of 780 flats in the project, there are 480 buyers whose investments are stuck," said a protester.

243.title: Kapil celebrates b'day with wife Ginny and daughter Anayra, pics surface
243.article_body: Comedian Kapil Sharma recently celebrated his 41st birthday with his mother, wife Ginni Chatrath, and daughter Anayra. Several videos and pictures surfaced online from his birthday party. In a video, Kapil was seen dancing as Ginni smiled and clapped her hands. At the event, a neon sign read 'Happy Birthday Kapil' and a two-tier white cake was also seen.

244.title: Heroine worth ₹113 cr found hidden in baggage at Kolkata airport
244.article_body: Three African nationals, including two women, were arrested after nearly 16.15 kg of heroin worth about ₹113 crore was found hidden in their trolley bags at Kolkata International Airport, an official said. The drug haul is believed to be the largest at the airport. The official added that 14 packets of a brown substance were concealed in the bags' cavities.

245.title: Joke writers pray people feel offended as that turns memorable: Varun Dhawan
245.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan said that during shows, writers who write jokes always pray that people should feel offended because "that turns into a memorable moment". "It's not so much to the host. We, as hosts, need to check what writers have written before going onto stage," Dhawan added. He also said not having releases in two years makes him anxious.

246.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases drop below 1,000 after 715 days; 13 deaths in 24 hours
246.article_body: India has reported 913 new COVID-19 cases, 1,316 recoveries and 13 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. With this, India's daily COVID-19 cases dropped below 1,000 after 715 days. India's active caseload dropped to 12,597 (less than 13,000 after 714 days), while the death toll reached 5,21,358.

247.title: He needs to find a way to start scoring: Jaffer on Ruturaj scoring 0, 1, 1
247.article_body: Ex-India batter Wasim Jaffer has said CSK opener Ruturaj Gaikwad "needs to find a way" to start scoring for the franchise in the ongoing IPL season. "Gaikwad does get out nicking. Even in first-class cricket, I have seen him get out behind the wickets," added Jaffer. In CSK's three games so far, Ruturaj has scored 0, 1 and 1.

248.title: Who won what at the 2022 Grammy Awards held today?
248.article_body: Silk Sonic, the group project of Bruno Mars and Anderson .Paak, won the Grammy Award for 'Record of the Year' for 'Leave the Door Open'. Jon Batiste's 'We Are' was named the 'Album of the Year'. Silk Sonic's 'Leave the Door Open' also won the 'Song of the Year' award. US' 19-year-old singer-songwriter Olivia Rodrigo was named 'Best New Artist'.

249.title: HDFC board approves merger of company with HDFC Bank
249.article_body: The board of Housing Development Finance Corporation (HDFC) has approved the merger of the firm with HDFC Bank. Following the merger, HDFC Bank will be 100% owned by public shareholders and existing shareholders of HDFC Limited will own 41% of HDFC Bank. "[It]...shall enable HDFC Bank to build its housing loan portfolio and enhance its existing customer base," HDFC said.

250.title: 28 girl students hospitalised after eating dinner at school hostel in UP
250.article_body: As many as 28 girl students were admitted to a hospital when they complained of uneasiness after having dinner at a residential school run by the Social Welfare Department in Uttar Pradesh's Budaun district. According to officials, the students are stable and would be discharged soon. District Magistrate Deepa Ranjan has formed a committee to investigate the incident.

251.title: Gurugram traffic police launch iRAD app to reduce road accidents
251.article_body: In a bid to reduce road accidents, Gurugram traffic police on Saturday launched an Integrated Road Accident Database (iRAD) that will help monitor and fix engineering defects in roads. The iRAD system comes with a mobile app through which investigation officers can store details of an accident along with pictures and videos using a unique ID.

252.title: Can’t build Amaravati in six months: Andhra Pradesh govt to HC
252.article_body: The YS Jagan Mohan Reddy-led government has told the High Court of Andhra Pradesh that it is practically impossible to complete the Amaravati capital city project within six months. This deadline was set by the court in its order a month ago. The state government has sought an extension of the time limit to 60 months.

253.title: Hyd airport's domestic passenger traffic at 109%, crosses pre-COVID level
253.article_body: Officials on Sunday said that the Hyderabad International Airport recorded 109 per cent of pre-COVID daily average domestic passenger traffic on a single day. "[It] is...now connected to over 70 domestic destinations from...pre-Covid period of 55 domestic destinations," an official release said. During the first half of March 2022, airport witnessed about seven lakh domestic passengers.

254.title: Drugs worth ₹3 crore seized in Assam’s Morigaon, 3 held
254.article_body: Police seized drugs worth around ₹3 crore on Sunday in Assam’s Morigaon district and apprehended three persons. Based on a tip-off, the police team of Morigaon district conducted checking at the Jagiroad Silbhanga area and intercepted a motorcycle. During the checking, the police team recovered 309 grams of drugs, Moon Prakash Tiwari, Officer-in-Charge of Jagiroad Police Station, said.

255.title: 6 killed, 12 injured in mass shooting in California
255.article_body: Multiple shooters opened fire at about 2 am on Sunday in California's state capital of Sacramento, killing six people and wounding 12 others, police said. Three men and three women were killed and at least four of the wounded were hospitalised with life-threatening injuries, police added. Authorities have not identified any of the victims or offered a possible motive.

256.title: Mumbai Traffic Police to seize vehicles of motorists driving on wrong side of road
256.article_body: Mumbai Traffic Police has decided to start seizing the vehicles of motorists who are found driving on the wrong side of the road, after 2,649 FIRs were filed for the offence between March 6 and 31. "It is observed that even after 25 days of launching an awareness campaign, people have not learnt a lesson," a senior police officer said.

257.title: 2 detained for threatening locals after videos went viral in Pune
257.article_body: The police have detained two men for allegedly threatening local residents in Pune after videos showing them wield sharp weapons and create law and order situations went viral. The police said that over a dozen such videos have been shared by the residents. "We are verifying these videos and a process of identifying the men is going on," said police.

258.title: Several areas of Chennai to face power cut today from 9 am to 2 pm
258.article_body: The Tamil Nadu Generation and Distribution Corporation (TANGEDCO) has announced that parts of Chennai will have a disruption to electrical power supply on Monday from 9 am to 2 pm. The supply will be cut in order to carry out maintenance work in the city. The affected areas will be Porur-Thirumudivakkam, Tidel Park/Ezhil Nagar, Avadi, Guindy, Tambaram and Sembium.

259.title: Man demands change in Hyd airport washroom signboard, authorities respond
259.article_body: A Twitter user said that the washroom signboard at the Rajiv Gandhi International Airport in Hyderabad that currently reads "Female" should be renamed to "Ladies". He said writing "Female" is "a bit crude and impolite". The airport authorities replied to his tweet saying that his suggestion has been noted and has been sent for consideration.

260.title: Found self-confidence in my 30s; didn't think about what others would say: Kim
260.article_body: Kim Kardashian, who recently appeared on the cover of Vogue Hong Kong, spoke about the lessons she learnt ever since she rose to fame. Kim said that she is now eating well, working out and having more fun with her family. She added that in her 30s she found self-confidence. "[I cared] less about what everyone else thought," Kim said.

261.title: Everyone holds their breath when Livingstone is batting: Mayank
261.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal praised batter Liam Livingstone for his performance against CSK on Sunday night. "[We] told Livingstone nothing. Everyone holds their breath when he is batting. Some of the shots he hits are spectacular," added Mayank. Livingstone came in to bat when PBKS were 14/2 and smashed 5 fours and 5 sixes in his 60-run innings.

262.title: 72 fall ill after eating food made from 'kuttu' flour in U'khand
262.article_body: At least 72 people have fallen ill after they consumed food made from buckwheat flour or 'kuttu ka atta' in various villages amid the Navaratri festival in Uttarakhand's Haridwar, District Magistrate Vinay Shankar Pandey said. The people have been shifted to a hospital and orders to stop the supply of buckwheat flour in the area have been given, he added.

263.title: Billie Eilish, Olivia Rodrigo walk red carpet at Grammys 2022
263.article_body: Several celebrities, including Billie Eilish, Olivia Rodrigo, Doja Cat, Chrissy Teigen and Tiffany Haddish, walked the red carpet at the 64th Grammy Awards in Las Vegas. Billie opted for a coat-turned-cape look. She completed the look with black shorts, boots and sunglasses. Meanwhile, Olivia wore a black gown with sequin detailing.

264.title: B'luru's Devarakere lake brims with water, hosts many birds: Report
264.article_body: Bengaluru's Devarakere lake, which a few years ago had become arid land, is brimming with water and now hosts several species of birds, the Indian Express reported. BBMP has also reportedly set aside ₹1.3 crore for the lake's restoration and is currently building a jogging track and gate. Furthermore, BBMP is working to construct a drain there, a contractor said.

265.title: Journalists assaulted, groped at 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' event in Delhi; 2 FIRs lodged
265.article_body: Delhi Police has registered two FIRs based on complaints filed by journalists, who alleged they were assaulted and groped during the 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' held at Delhi's Burari ground, where head priest of Dasna Devi temple, Yati Narsinghanand, spoke. Some journalists alleged that a group of men snatched their phones and deleted all videos. Police said the journalists were given protection.

266.title: We didn't find the momentum from ball one: Jadeja on defeat vs PBKS
266.article_body: CSK captain Ravindra Jadeja said they couldn't find the "momentum from ball one" while chasing PBKS' 181-run target and lost too many wickets during the powerplay. "We need to find a way to get better and come back stronger," he added. CSK lost the match by 54 runs after getting bundled out for 126 runs.

267.title: Petrol, diesel prices hiked for 12th time in 14 days
267.article_body: Petrol and diesel prices have been hiked for the 12th time in 14 days. Petrol in Delhi now costs ₹103.81/litre after being increased by 40 paise/litre, while diesel price in the national capital has gone up to ₹95.07/litre from ₹94.67/litre. In Mumbai, petrol cost has jumped to ₹118.83/litre from ₹118.41/litre, and diesel price has been increased to ₹103.07/litre from ₹102.64/litre.

268.title: Support us in any way you can but not silence: Zelenskyy in taped video at Grammys
268.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy appeared in a taped video at the Grammy Awards in Las Vegas on Sunday. Zelenskyy said, "What is more opposite to music? The silence of ruined cities and killed people." He added, "Tell the truth about the war on your social networks, on TV. Support us in any way you can - any, but not silence."

269.title: Trevor Noah, Questlove joke about Oscars slap incident at Grammys 2022
269.article_body: Referencing the Will Smith and Chris Rock slap incident at Oscars, Grammys 2022 host Trevor Noah, during the ceremony, joked, "We are going to be keeping people's names out of our mouths." American musician Questlove, while presenting an award, joked, "I'm going to present this award and I trust that you people will stay 500 feet away from me."

270.title: Liam Livingstone smashes the biggest six of IPL 2022
270.article_body: Punjab Kings' batting-all-rounder Liam Livingstone smashed a 108-metre maximum on the bowling of Chennai Super Kings' fast bowler Mukesh Choudhary to record the biggest six of IPL 2022 so far. Livingstone broke his own record as he had earlier hit a 105-metre six in IPL 2022. Livingstone has hit eight sixes in IPL 2022 so far.

271.title: Flesh trade racket busted at spa centre in Pune; 4 women rescued
271.article_body: Pune's Pimpri Chinchwad Police have rescued four women after they busted an alleged flesh trade racket at a spa and wellness centre in Pimple Saudagar. Police had conducted a raid at the spa on April 1,  after receiving a tip-off for the same. The 25-year-old spa manager has been arrested and a search is on for the spa's female owner.

272.title: All 26 Cabinet Ministers of Sri Lanka resign amid economic crisis
272.article_body: All 26 Cabinet Ministers of Sri Lanka have resigned amid the country's worst economic crisis of all time. Thousands of Sri Lankans defied a nationwide curfew on Sunday and took to the streets to protest against the government's handling of the economic crisis. Sri Lanka President Gotabaya Rajapaksa and his brother, Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa, have held on to power.

273.title: Didn't know where to hold hands or keep on waist, was scared: Vidya on trolling
273.article_body: While speaking about trolling, actress Vidya Balan said that she remembers making headlines for the wrong reasons. "I used to be heartbroken and devastated. I used to be so low on confidence...I didn't know where to hold my hands by my side....or keep them on waist...I was always so scared of what I would get picked on for," Vidya added.

274.title: ₹1 crore refunded to patients overcharged for COVID treatment: PMC
274.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation has said it helped 142 patients, who were overcharged for COVID-19 treatment by private hospitals, to get refunds amounting to ₹1 crore. "We sent out multiple notices to private hospitals...The final show cause notice... [stated] that if they fail to respond we might even cancel their licence for six months," said an official.

275.title: Pak Army has nothing to do with current political crisis: Official
275.article_body: The Pakistani Army has "absolutely nothing" to do with the current political crisis in the country, a military spokesman said. The comment comes after President Arif Alvi dissolved the National Assembly on the advice of PM Imran Khan to make way for fresh elections. Earlier, a no-confidence motion against Khan was rejected by the Deputy Speaker of the National Assembly.

276.title: Imran Khan de-notified as Prime Minister of Pakistan
276.article_body: In a circular issued by the Pakistan Cabinet Division, Imran Khan has been de-notified as the PM of Pakistan. This comes as the President dissolved the National Assembly after it rejected a no-trust move against Khan. According to Article 224 of Pakistan's Constitution, Khan can continue as the PM for 15 days till the appointment of a caretaker PM.

277.title: CSK bowled out for lowest total of IPL 2022 against PBKS, lose 3 matches in a row
277.article_body: PBKS defeated CSK by 54 runs in their IPL 2022 encounter on Sunday. PBKS put up a total of 180/8 and bowled CSK out for 126 runs in 18 overs. CSK's 126 is the lowest total of IPL 2022 so far. CSK have now lost three matches in a row and they are currently ninth on the points table.

278.title: NIA conducts searches across 17 places in Assam, arrests 1 Naxal
278.article_body: The NIA on Sunday conducted searches at 17 locations across Assam and arrested a Naxal. The suspect had been absconding and was apprehended for allegedly spreading the network of CPI (Maoist) in the northeast region of the country. According to an official spokesperson of the NIA, the searches were carried out at places in Cachar, Karimganj, Dibrugarh and Dhubri districts.

279.title: Video shows Bharti Singh working a day before giving birth, fans praise her
279.article_body: A video of comedian Bharti Singh working on Saturday started doing the rounds online after she gave birth to her son on Sunday. The video showed Bharti and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on the sets of a shoot. Many fans praised Singh with one saying, "What a rockstar", while another saying, "Commendable work ethics."

280.title: UP CM to launch 'School Chalo Abhiyan' in Shravasti on Monday
280.article_body: The 'School Chalo Abhiyan', aimed at ensuring 100% enrolment in primary and upper primary schools in Uttar Pradesh, will be launched by CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday. The programme is being started in the Shravasti district which has the lowest literacy rate in the state. According to the official release, the CM has told MLAs to adopt a school each.

281.title: US to give $50 million to Moldova to cope with Ukraine crisis
281.article_body: US will give an aid of $50 million to Ukraine's neighbouring Moldova to help the latter cope with impact of Russia's invasion of Ukraine, US Ambassador to UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield said on Sunday. The aid will support programmes, training and equipment for border management, she said. The US had earlier pledged $30 million to Moldova to assist refugee relief efforts.

282.title: After Gambhir, KKR under Shreyas is the team to beat in IPL: Irfan
282.article_body: Following Shreyas Iyer-led KKR's two wins from three matches in IPL 2022 so far, former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said KKR is looking "very solid" as far as the team's leadership is concerned. "After Gautam Gambhir, under Shreyas, this is the team to beat," he stated. Gambhir led KKR to two IPL titles in 2012 and 2014.

283.title: Hardik has put talks around his fitness to rest in IPL 2022: Swann
283.article_body: Ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann said GT skipper Hardik Pandya is one of the main reasons for the franchise's two wins from two matches in IPL 2022. He added that the all-rounder has put all the talks about his fitness to rest by bowling quick. In both games, Hardik bowled his full quota of four overs and batted at number four.

284.title: Female patient dies in JP Hospital's washroom in MP's Bhopal
284.article_body: A 32-year-old female patient died in a washroom of a government district hospital in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal. Civil surgeon Dr Rakesh Srivastava confirmed that the patient died at JP Hospital on Saturday. While doctors maintain that the woman died of cardiac arrest, the hospital administration is waiting for the post mortem report to confirm the cause of death.

285.title: Couple robbed of car at gunpoint in Punjab's Amritsar, probe on
285.article_body: A couple was robbed of their car at gunpoint outside the Beant Singh Park in Punjab's Amritsar on Saturday. The victims, Ankur Kumar and his wife, were sitting in their parked Swift when three unknown persons approached them and pointed a pistol at them, police said, adding, "The miscreants snatched the car's key from the couple and drove it away."

286.title: MS Dhoni becomes second Indian to feature in 350 T20 matches
286.article_body: Former CSK captain MS Dhoni has become the second Indian cricketer to feature in 350 T20 matches. The CSK-PBKS IPL 2022 clash is Dhoni's 350th match in T20 cricket. MI captain Rohit Sharma has played the most number of T20 matches (372) among Indians. Rohit and Dhoni are followed by Suresh Raina, who has played 336 T20 matches.

287.title: Bezos shares pic of Amazon office from early days, says 'Big things start small'
287.article_body: The world's second-richest man Jeff Bezos on Sunday took to Instagram to share a picture of his office from Amazon's early days, and wrote, "Big things start small." The office had 'amazon.com' spray-painted on a banner and a table built out of a wooden door. He also shared a video of his company Blue Origin's fourth spaceflight with astronauts aboard.

288.title: All-round development being done without any bias: Haryana CM
288.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said his government is ensuring that "all-round development is being done in every sphere of the state without any bias". "There is no place for corruption in the state and those who indulge in such activities will not be spared," Khattar said after laying the foundation stone of 18 projects worth ₹135 crore.

289.title: Gujarat policeman caught slapping 13-yr-old boy on CCTV, suspended
289.article_body: A policeman, who was caught on CCTV slapping a 13-year-old boy in a marketplace in Gujarat's Vadodara, has been suspended for misconduct following an inquiry. The personnel, Shaktisinh Pvra, was travelling in his official vehicle "when he noticed the child muttering something at him...He got down, slapped the child several times and also twisted his arm", an official said.

290.title: Jordan's ex-Crown Prince gives up title a year after public rift
290.article_body: Jordan's ex-Crown Prince Hamzah bin Al Hussein on Sunday relinquished his princely title. In a letter, Prince Hamzah said he gave up his title because his values "are not in line with the...modern methods of our institutions". Notably, this comes a month after a royal court statement said he had apologised to the King for last year's aborted coup.

291.title: Explosion in Afghanistan's capital Kabul, at least 15 people injured
291.article_body: An explosion in centre of Afghanistan's capital Kabul on Sunday injured at least 15 people, said witnesses. However, the cause of the blast wasn't immediately clear. Reportedly, the blast occurred inside a market which was immediately closed after the blast and the Taliban surrounded the area. This comes despite the Taliban stepping up security since they assumed power last year.

292.title: CBI no more a 'caged parrot', it's truly performing its duty: Rijiju
292.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju on Sunday said, "CBI is no more a 'caged parrot' but truly performing its duty as India's top criminal investigating agency." He added that there was a time when "those who [sat] in the government" used to become a problem in investigations. Challenges faced by officers in the past are "no more in existence", he added.

293.title: 3 militants accused in murder case escape from jail in Tripura
293.article_body: Three trained militants, arrested in connection with the murder of businessman Litan Das, escaped from a jail in Tripura on Saturday. According to reports, the on-duty personnel at Kanchanpur sub-jail were busy opening the main entrance when they were overpowered by the undertrials. "An inquiry is underway...possible hideouts are being raided...to trace them as soon as possible," police said.

294.title: Officials capture leopard killing cattle in Assam's Golaghat
294.article_body: A wild leopard, which reportedly killed several cattle and goats, was captured in a cage by Forest Department staff in Assam's Golaghat district on Sunday. The leopard will be tranquilised and sent to the Centre for Wildlife Rehabilitation and Conservation, an official said, adding that at least 14 leopards have been caught in the area so far.

295.title: Sri Lanka PM office denies reports of PM's resignation amid economic crisis
295.article_body: Amid the economic crisis, Sri Lanka PM's Office has dismissed reports of PM Mahinda Rajapaksa’s resignation. Earlier, a media report mentioned possible resignations of the PM as well as Finance Minister Basil Rajapaksa. Sri Lanka has declared a countrywide emergency amid escalating protests over the economic crisis that has led to a shortage of fuel, and food among other things.

296.title: Blasts heard in Russia's Belgorod near Ukrainian border: Report
296.article_body: Two explosions were heard in Russia's Belgorod near Ukrainian border on Sunday, witnesses reported. One of the witnesses added that the blasts were so powerful that they rattled the windows of her home in Belgorod. However, the cause of the blasts was not immediately clear. This comes days after Russia said two Ukrainian helicopters struck a fuel depot in Belgorod.

297.title: Ban on girls' education is damaging entire Afghanistan: UN chief
297.article_body: UN chief Antonio Guterres has expressed concern over the Taliban's move to keep high schools closed to girls, stating that such a ban will damage the entire country. Guterres added that the decision is an unjustifiable violation of equal rights. Taliban issued a decree last month banning girls studying in grade six and above from attending school until further orders.

298.title: Hate speech accused Narsinghanand speaks at 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' held in Delhi
298.article_body: The head priest of Ghaziabad's Dasna Devi Temple, Yati Narsinghanand, on Sunday spoke at a 'Hindu Mahapanchayat' held at New Delhi's Burari ground. In videos shared on social media, the Haridwar hate speech case accused, urged Hindus to take up arms. Delhi Police said the event's organisers did not have permission to hold it.

299.title: North Korea criticises South Korea's preemptive strike comments
299.article_body: Kim Yo-jong, the sister of North Korean leader Kim Jong-un, has criticised South Korean Defence Minister Suh Wook for talking about preemptive strikes on North Korea. "South Korea may face a serious threat owing to...reckless remarks made by its Defence Minister," she said. Suh had said that South Korea has the readiness to launch strikes on North Korea.

300.title: Chandigarh was, is & will remain Haryana's capital: CM Khattar
300.article_body: Two days after the Punjab assembly passed a resolution seeking immediate transfer of Chandigarh to the state, Haryana Chief Minister Manohar Lal Khattar on Sunday said that Chandigarh was and will remain Haryana's capital. "We will not let Chandigarh go anywhere. As long as the people of Haryana are with us, nothing can happen," he said.

301.title: Russia says it will suspend ISS cooperation until sanctions are lifted
301.article_body: The head of the Russian space agency Roscosmos, Dmitry Rogozin said that Russia will end cooperation on the ISS and will suspend its partnership with NASA and others until sanctions are lifted. Rogozin said the aim of the sanctions was to "kill the Russian economy and plunge our people into despair and hunger, to get our country on its knees."

302.title: Gary Oldman to appear in Nolan's 'Oppenheimer' for one scene
302.article_body: Actor Gary Oldman will be appearing in one scene of Christopher Nolan's upcoming film 'Oppenheimer'. Gary, speaking on a UK radio station, said he has to shoot for the film for one day. Gary has previously worked with Christopher Nolan in the 'Batman' trilogy. Cillian Murphy, Robert Downey Jr, Emily Blunt and Rami Malek will also feature in the film.

303.title: Lithuania becomes 1st EU country to end Russian gas imports
303.article_body: Lithuania will no longer import gas from Russia to meet its domestic needs, becoming the first European Union (EU) member country to break its energy dependence on Moscow, the Lithuanian energy ministry said on Saturday. All gas for Lithuania's domestic consumption will be supplied via Klaipeda’s liquified natural gas (LNG) terminal. The terminal, called 'Independence', was inaugurated in 2014.

304.title: Russian forces committed 'massive abuses' in Ukraine, says France
304.article_body: France's Foreign Minister Jean-Yves Le Drian on Sunday condemned "massive abuses" committed by Russian forces in Ukraine in recent weeks. Local authorities have said that a deliberate "massacre" was carried out by Russian forces in Bucha, a town outside of the Ukrainian capital of Kyiv. The images coming from Bucha are "unbearable", French President Emmanuel Macron said in a tweet.

305.title: 11 Ukrainian mayors abducted by Russian forces: Deputy PM
305.article_body: Ukrainian Deputy PM Iryna Vereshchuk on Sunday claimed that 11 heads of communities in the regions of Kyiv, Kherson, Kharkiv, Zaporizhzhia, Mykolaiv and Donetsk are in captivity since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24. Vereshchuk added that Olga Sukhenko, head of Motyjin village and her husband had been "killed in captivity" by Russian soldiers.

306.title: More than 90 migrants drown in Mediterranean Sea: Report
306.article_body: Doctors Without Borders (MSF) on Saturday said that more than 90 migrants in an overcrowded boat drowned in the Mediterranean Sea. As per MSF, the migrants were on a vessel that left Libya last week. Meanwhile, UN's International Organization for Migration said nearly 300 migrants died or were presumed dead along Central Mediterranean route between January 1 and March 28.

307.title: Man catches 'living dinosaur' fish weighing 159 kg in Canada river, shares video
307.article_body: A man in Canada's Alberta shared a video of an 8 feet 6 inches long sturgeon fish, also known as the 'living dinosaur', that weighed about 159 kilograms. Braeden Rouse reeled the massive fish in from the Fraser River. Rouse said the fish took him a kilometre downstream before he landed her.

308.title: Wishes are more than enough: Arjun Bijlani on pic of fan who tattooed his face
308.article_body: Arjun Bijlani took to Instagram to share a picture of his fan who got the actor's face tattooed on his arm, and wrote, "Unbelievable. Lots of love." However, Bijlani added, "It's humbling when fans show so much love but I really wish they wouldn't put themselves in such pain." He said, "Their messages and their wishes are more than enough."

309.title: WhatsApp banned over 14 lakh Indian accounts in Feb 2022: Report
309.article_body: WhatsApp banned 14,26,000 India-based accounts in February 2022 based on grievances received from users via the instant messaging platform's grievance mechanism, according to WhatsApp's ninth monthly user safety report. Additionally, accounts that violated Indian laws or WhatsApp's terms of services were also banned. WhatsApp had earlier banned 18.58 lakh Indian accounts in January 2022.

310.title: Ranbir will undergo body transformation for 'Animal': Fitness coach
310.article_body: Fitness coach Shivohaam has said actor Ranbir Kapoor will undergo "some kind of" body transformation for his upcoming film 'Animal'. "He told me that he will give me the brief soon...In the first schedule he said, they are not going to reveal much, probably that will be in the latter part," he stated. Sandeep Reddy Vanga will direct the film.

311.title: Patidar joins RCB squad as a replacement for injured Sisodia in IPL 2022
311.article_body: RCB have signed Rajat Patidar, who had previously represented the franchise four times, as a replacement for injured Luvnith Sisodia for remainder of IPL 2022. The 28-year-old right-handed batter will join RCB for ₹20 lakh. Patidar represents Madhya Pradesh in domestic cricket and has so far played 31 T20s, scoring 861 runs. RCB will face RR on Tuesday.

312.title: BJP, Cong criticise Delhi govt for allowing 25% discount on liquor
312.article_body: BJP and Congress on Saturday criticised the Delhi government for allowing liquor stores to offer up to 25% discount. Delhi Congress president Anil Kumar said that the government allowed the discount on liquor to "hurt the sentiments" of people observing Navratri. Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor said that such a scheme would increase liquor consumption amongst the youngsters.

313.title: Punjab to recruit 10,500 teachers to fill shortage of staff: Minister
313.article_body: The Punjab government will recruit 10,500 teachers soon to fill the shortage of teaching staff, Education Minister Gurmeet Singh Meet Hayer said on Sunday. "AAP government in Punjab led by Bhagwant Singh Mann is committed to transforming education as well as sports scenarios in the state in letter and spirit," Hayer further said.

314.title: 324 K'taka govt employees found holding illegal BPL cards, fined
314.article_body: Government employees found holding illegal BPL cards in Karnataka's Dharwad are being searched and fined. The HRMS data revealed there are 324 such employees, of which 24 have already been fined and a total fine of ₹7,08,000 has been collected. While the remaining 300 are yet to pay the fine, all such employees' cards have been cancelled to avoid misuse.

315.title: He's pure talent, made for T20 format: Shastri on Gill's best-ever IPL score
315.article_body: Praising Shubman Gill after he achieved his best-ever IPL score (46-ball 84) in GT's last match in IPL 2022, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said the 22-year-old opener is "pure talent" and is made for T20 format. "Once he gets going he'll score and...makes it look easy. He's got that punch...time and...power to play along the ground," he added.

316.title: 2 people injured in train derailment near Maharashtra's Nashik
316.article_body: Two passengers have reportedly been injured in a train derailment near Nashik in Maharashtra. The Central Railway on Sunday said that both victims suffered minor injuries and were given primary treatment. An official said that a body was found near the railway track but it is not a passenger and is thought to have been there before the derailment.

317.title: Russia must pay for 'war crimes' in Ukraine's Bucha: Germany
317.article_body: German Foreign Minister Annalena Baerbock said on Sunday that Russia must pay for its "war crimes" in Ukraine's Bucha in the form of more severe sanctions. "Images from Bucha are unbearable, Putin's rampant violence is wiping out innocent families and knows no boundaries," she tweeted. Almost 300 people have been buried in mass graves in Bucha, its mayor has said.

318.title: Terrorists shoot at 2 men from Punjab in J&K's Pulwama district
318.article_body: Terrorists shot at and injured two men from Punjab in the Pulwama district of Jammu and Kashmir on Sunday, police said. The men were injured in the attack at Nowpora in the Litter area of Pulwama, the police added. They were shifted to the district hospital in Pulwama, from where one of them was referred to SMHS hospital in Srinagar.

319.title: Sexual harassment accused paraded with garland of shoes in Assam
319.article_body: A man who allegedly molested a seven-year-old minor girl in Assam was made to walk through an entire village wearing a garland of footwear. The incident took place in the Kathonibari area in Biswanath district where a group of villagers also allegedly thrashed him and painted his face. The accused, identified as 56-year-old Mohim Bora, was arrested by police.

320.title: Halal meat issue being raised to disturb peace: Siddaramaiah
320.article_body: Congress leader and former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah said the halal meat issue is being made out to be a major issue to disturb the peace in society. "These are not issues that are relevant to people or the lives of people," Siddaramaiah said. "Do we not buy halal meat and eat it? We eat it often," he added.

321.title: 2 arrested for possessing banned sea cucumbers in TN's Rameswaram
321.article_body: Two people were arrested near Tamil Nadu's Serankottai beach by Rameswaram Coastal Security Wing for allegedly possessing sea cucumbers. The fishery of sea cucumbers is banned in India and they are protected under Wildlife (Protection) Act. The accused have been booked for hunting and procuring the endangered species, which is consumed in some parts of the world.

322.title: Technical problem shuts most of rail network in Netherlands
322.article_body: The Dutch national railway operator NS on Sunday announced that most of the rail network in the country was shut down due to an unspecified technical problem. "We are working hard on a recovery but, alas, we cannot now say how long this situation will persist," it said. The regional trains in the Netherlands are still running, it added.

323.title: MS Dhoni pulls off diving run out after running at top speed of 23 kmph, video goes viral
323.article_body: CSK's 40-year-old wicketkeeper MS Dhoni pulled off a run out with a dive after running at a top speed of 23 kmph during their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. CSK pacer Chris Jordan missed a direct hit after Bhanuka Rajapaksa was sent back by Shikhar Dhawan. Dhoni sprinted and collected the ball before executing the dive and running Rajapaksa out.

324.title: Any BBL team would love to have a player like Babar Azam: Finch
324.article_body: Australia white-ball skipper Aaron Finch said if Pakistan captain Babar Azam decides to participate in Big Bash League (BBL), Australia's domestic cricket league, any team would "love" to have him. "I just asked Babar if he's interested in coming and playing for Melbourne Renegades and he certainly is–and hopefully, we can announce that signing tomorrow!" Finch joked.

325.title: J&K Police bust 2 terror modules, arrest 5 LeT associates in Bandipora
325.article_body: The Jammu and Kashmir Police on Sunday busted two terror modules and arrested five terror associates linked with the Lashkar-e-Taiba from the Bandipora district. The five accused, who were caught in separate incidents, were reportedly nabbed while providing logistics and transportation to the terrorist group. At least three Chinese grenades were also retrieved from the accused's possession.

326.title: Bhumi to star in Karan Boolani's 'Thank You For Coming': Report
326.article_body: Bhumi Pednekar will reportedly star in 'Thank You For Coming', which will mark Karan Boolani's directorial debut. "Film is produced by Rhea Kapoor under her banner and is in conversation with another...producer to come on board as...studio partner," a source stated. The source added that the title and cast of the film will be announced once the shoot is completed.

327.title: No insecurities: Jr NTR on Ram getting more screen time in 'RRR'
327.article_body: Actor Jr NTR, talking about Ram Charan getting more screen time in 'RRR', has said, "I...am aware of the fact...SS Rajamouli (director) has given equal importance to both Ram and Bheem roles." Jr NTR further said that there were no insecurities involved with Ram and added, "We both complimented each other beautifully."

328.title: Russian troops given poisoned food & alcohol by Ukrainian civilians: Officials
328.article_body: Two Russian troops were killed and many were injured after being given poisoned food and alcohol by civilians in Ukraine's Kharkiv region, Ukrainian officials said. Some 28 Russian troops were in intensive care, while another 500 were taken to hospitals due to heavy alcohol poisoning, they added. Ukrainian civilians were resisting the Russian forces by all available means, officials said.

329.title: Zeke Smith proposes to Nico Santos onstage at GLAAD Media Awards
329.article_body: Television personality Zeke Smith proposed to actor Nico Santos onstage during the 2022 GLAAD Media Awards on Saturday. "Nico, your love has taught me how to love...I want to spend the rest of my life with you," Zeke said. The couple first met in 2018 at the GLAAD Media Awards and made their relationship social media official two months later.

330.title: 20-yr-old UP woman kills self after objectionable pics posted online
330.article_body: A 20-year-old woman in Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur allegedly killed herself by consuming poison after her objectionable pictures were posted online by some men. Four people, including the main accused, have been arrested. The girl had reportedly filed a complaint but no action was taken. A police constable has been suspended for the alleged negligence.

331.title: My mom has 21 cousins in Iran, want to take her there for next film's shoot: John
331.article_body: Actor John Abraham told Pinkvilla, "My next film is called 'Tehran'...and I will be shooting in Iran." He added, "My mom (Firoza Irani) has got 21 cousins in Iran and I want to go and shoot there and I want to take her there." He added, "She wants to meet some of them so I'm very excited about going there."

332.title: We don't own a house, my only aim is to get a house for my parents with IPL salary: Tilak
332.article_body: MI's 19-year-old batting-allrounder Tilak Varma, who scored 61(33) against RR, has said that his family doesn't own a house as yet. He added, "With whatever I have earned in this IPL, my only aim is to get a house for my parents. This IPL money gives me the luxury to play freely for the rest of my career," he added.

333.title: India’s position on Russia-Ukraine conflict consistent: President
333.article_body: India's position on the ongoing conflict in Ukraine has been steadfast and consistent, said President Ram Nath Kovind. "We have emphasised that the current global order is anchored in international law, the UN Charter and respect for territorial integrity and sovereignty of states," the President added. He further said, "We are deeply concerned about the worsening humanitarian situation."

334.title: Ukraine shows dead bodies, corpse with tied hands appears to be shot in mouth
334.article_body: Ukrainian city Bucha's mayor Anatoly Fedoruk showed journalists the dead bodies in an area that, he said, Chechen fighters controlled during the month that Russian forces occupied the city. "One corpse appeared to have hands bound by a white cloth...and to have been shot in the mouth," Reuters reported. "Russians have demonstrated that they were consciously killing civilians," Fedoruk said.

335.title: 6 dead, 10 injured in mass shooting in US' Sacramento: Police
335.article_body: A mass shooting in California's Sacramento has killed six people and left 10 others injured, according to the police. Authorities don't know the number of suspects involved in the shooting and have asked for the public's help in identifying the suspects. This is "a very complex and complicated scene", Sacramento Police Chief Kathy Lester said.

336.title: A 'potentate' has unleashed nuclear war threat: Pope on Ukraine crisis
336.article_body: A "potentate" (an autocratic monarch) has unleashed the threat of nuclear war on the world, Pope Francis said in an implicit criticism of Russian President Vladimir Putin amid Ukraine's invasion. Calling the invasion "savage", Pope stated that the "potentate" was engaging in conflict for nationalist gains. "We...thought that invasions...and atomic threats were grim memories of...past," he added.

337.title: Man stabs landlord to death in Gujarat, arrested within 15 mins
337.article_body: A man allegedly stabbed his landlord to death with a knife in Gujarat's Ahmedabad on Saturday following an argument over rent. The accused fled after the incident but was arrested within 15 minutes. The patrolling unit had reportedly become suspicious after finding him with bloodstains after which they brought him back to the area where he was identified by locals.

338.title: Missing teacher's body found in a pond with hands & legs tied in UP
338.article_body: The body of a 42-year-old teacher was recovered from a pond in Uttar Pradesh's Bhadohi district, with his hands and legs tied up, a day after he went missing, police said. According to the complaint lodged by the family, the deceased had a property dispute. He left his home on Saturday evening after a phone call, the report added.

339.title: Police recover crude bombs from a football ground in WB's Birbhum
339.article_body: The police recovered crude bombs in a plastic bag near a ground in Sikandarpur village of West Bengal's Birbhum district on Sunday. "A bomb squad team of CID was called to defuse the bombs," said Birbhum Superintendent of Police Nagendra Nath Tripathi. Raids were conducted as part of the 10-day drive to unearth illegal arms and ammunition in the state.

340.title: High time we understand it's 1 film industry, not categories: Yash
340.article_body: 'K.G.F: Chapter 2' actor Yash at a press meet stated that it is high time we understand that it is one film industry and stopped classifying Indian cinema into subcategories. "If today...I will come to Bombay and make a film for every part of this country...it just can't be a Hindi film. It will be an Indian film," he added.

341.title: 'Operation Romeo' about moral policing experienced by all: Producer
341.article_body: 'Operation Romeo' producer Neeraj Pandey has stated that everyone has experienced moral policing of varying intensities at least once in their lives. "That's the reason we thought to make a film on it. The plot is intense and based on a specific incident," he added. It is helmed by Shashant Shah and features Bhumika Chawla, Sidhant Gupta and Sharad Kelkar.

342.title: To bowl with 'boom boom' Bumrah in nets has been special: MI's Meredith
342.article_body: MI pacer Riley Meredith said bowling in the nets with teammate Jasprit Bumrah has been "special" for him in IPL 2022. "At the moment, it's hard to get past the big 'boom boom' Bumrah...he's a great fellow and is more than happy to share some tricks with me," he added. Meredith hasn't featured in any match for MI so far.

343.title: Naga Babu's daughter among 144 detained at Hyd rave party, cocaine seized
343.article_body: Around 144 people, including actor Naga Babu Konidela's daughter and actress Niharika, were detained in a drugs raid at a rave party in an upscale pub in Hyderabad's Banjara Hills. Five packets of cocaine were found during the raid, police said. The winner of the third season of Bigg Boss Telugu Rahul Sipligunj and several politicians' children were also detained.

344.title: No Pakistani Prime Minister has ever completed a full 5-yr term in office
344.article_body: In Pakistan’s history, no Prime Minister has ever completed a full 5-year term in office. While the first PM Liaquat Ali Khan, was assassinated, others left due to the imposition of martial law or their governments getting dissolved. Notably, the no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan was rejected and fresh elections will be held in 90 days.

345.title: Shia LaBeouf and partner Mia Goth welcome their first baby
345.article_body: Actor Shia LeBeouf and his partner model-actress Mia Goth have welcomed their first baby together. While they haven't made an official announcement, the couple was seen pushing a baby stroller in Los Angeles on Friday. Shia and Mia were previously married from 2016 to 2018 before separating amicably. They later rekindled their relationship and quarantined together during the COVID-19 lockdown.

346.title: My Insta account is probably hacked, beware of unusual activity: Yami
346.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, taking to Twitter on Sunday, has said that she has been unable to access her Instagram account. "It's probably hacked. We're trying to recover it as soon as possible," she added. "If there is any unusual activity through my account, please be aware of it," the actress further stated.

347.title: India to send 5 more aid consignments to Sri Lanka till May
347.article_body: India will send five more consignments of aid to Sri Lanka till May amid a severe economic crisis, Gopal Baglay, the Indian High Commissioner to the South Asian country, announced. Four consignments totaling over 1,50,000 tonnes of jet fuel, diesel and petrol have been delivered by India since March, he said. Currently, Sri Lanka has imposed a curfew.

348.title: Exorcist arrested for beating, scorching 14-yr-old in Jharkhand
348.article_body: An exorcist was arrested in Jharkhand's Chatra district for allegedly beating up a 14-year-old girl and scorching her with incense sticks to "ward off evil spirits," police said on Sunday. The girl had fallen sick after Holi and the accused assured her family that she would get better through exorcism, police said.

349.title: Videos of kangaroos roaming on West Bengal roads go viral; probe launched
349.article_body: Videos of kangaroos purportedly roaming on the roads of West Bengal have gone viral on social media. Responding to one of such videos, IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted, "They are part of smuggling." Divisional Forest Officer Hari Krishnan called the spottings "unusual", adding that a probe has been launched to investigate how and from where the animals reached nearby forests.

350.title: I'm partially to blame for centralising the internet: Twitter ex-CEO Dorsey
350.article_body: Twitter Co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey expressed his regrets for the current state of the internet and said, "I realise I'm partially to blame." Referring to earlier online communications systems, Dorsey tweeted, "The days of usenet, irc [Internet Relay Chat], the web...even email (w PGP)...were amazing. Centralising discovery and identity into corporations really damaged the internet."

351.title: Goa CM retains Home & Finance Depts as portfolios allocated in new Cabinet
