351.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant on Sunday allocated portfolios to his eight Cabinet colleagues and retained the Home and Finance Ministries. Sawant also holds the Personnel and Vigilance portfolios. Rohan Khaunte, who joined BJP ahead of the state Assembly polls, will handle Tourism and Information Technology departments among others. Vishwajit Rane retained Health and Women and Child Development portfolios.

352.title: I'm not getting to go to the Grammys, I'm slammed this month: Miranda
352.article_body: Singer Miranda Lambert said she'll be missing the 64th Grammy Awards due to her hectic schedule following the release of her new album and upcoming tour. "I'm not getting to go again...I'm slammed this month, with the record coming out and everything," she stated. Lambert is nominated for Best Country Duo/Group Performance and Best Country Album in this year's Grammys.

353.title: FPIs withdraw ₹41,000 cr in Mar, become net sellers for 6th month
353.article_body: Foreign portfolio investors (FPIs) withdrew net ₹41,123 crore from the Indian equity market in March 2022. With this, FPIs became net sellers for the sixth consecutive month, having withdrawn net ₹1.48 lakh crore between October 2021 and March 2022. Apart from equities, the debt segment witnessed net outflows of ₹5,632 crore in March.

354.title: Unemployment rate dropping in India, fell to 7.6% in March: CMIE
354.article_body: India's unemployment rate is decreasing and fell to 7.6% in March 2022, the Centre for Monitoring Indian Economy's (CMIE) data showed. The unemployment ratio further dropped to 7.5% on April 2, with urban unemployment at 8.5% and rural at 7.1%. Haryana recorded the highest unemployment rate in March at 26.7%, while Gujarat and Karnataka recorded the lowest at 1.8%.

355.title: CSK to bowl first against PBKS after winning their 1st toss in IPL 2022, playing XIs out
355.article_body: Chennai Super Kings (CSK) captain Ravindra Jadeja won his first toss in IPL 2022 and elected to bowl first against PBKS. CSK have made one change to their playing XI, with Chris Jordan replacing Tushar Deshpande. PBKS have made two changes to their playing XI, with Vaibhav Arora and Jitesh Sharma replacing Harpreet Brar and Raj Bawa.

356.title: Pune diesel prices rise to ₹100.60 per litre after 11th hike in 13 days
356.article_body: The diesel prices in Pune crossed the ₹100 per litre mark on Sunday after the 11th hike in prices in 13 days. The diesel in the city now costs ₹100.60 per litre, a rise of 83 paise from April 2, while petrol costs ₹117.87 per litre. The diesel price in Mumbai has been increased to ₹102.64 per litre from ₹101.79/litre.

357.title: Millionaire YouTuber Logan Paul wears most expensive Pokemon card at WWE debut
357.article_body: Millionaire YouTuber Logan Paul, who made his WWE WrestleMania debut recently, wore the world’s most expensive Pokemon card as a necklace. Paul wore a PSA Grade 10 Pikachu Illustrator card that he bought last year for $5,275,000 (around ₹40 crore). Paul's Pikachu card is one of the rarest Pokemon cards as only 39 of those exist in the world.

358.title: I've always wanted to represent India globally: Ranveer Singh
358.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh has stated that he has always wanted to represent India globally. He added that as an actor he can represent the country and its universal themes with his work to millions of people across the world. "I find that humbling," Ranveer said. He further stated we are on the cusp of getting recognition on a global scale.

359.title: Didn't realise how good a player Moeen is until he joined CSK: Hussey
359.article_body: Speaking about Moeen Ali's batting, CSK batting coach Michael Hussey said the CSK all-rounder is an "unbelievable player and a beautiful batter". He added, "I only watched him closely for...first time when he joined CSK squad in the last season...I didn't realise [until then] how good a player he actually is." Moeen scored 35 runs off 22 balls against LSG.

360.title: We deserved a victory today: Lanning on Aus winning 2022 Women's WC
360.article_body: After Australia defeated England by 71 runs and won 2022 Women's World Cup title, Australia captain Meg Lanning said her side deserved the victory on Sunday. "We've been extremely consistent over a long period of time," she added. Australia didn't lose a single match in tournament, winning nine games on the trot. It is Australia's record-extending seventh World Cup title.

361.title: Delhi Police's IFSO unit arrests 8 for Chinese loan app fraud
361.article_body: Eight people were arrested by Delhi Police's Intelligence Fusion and Strategic Operations (IFSO) unit for abusing and extorting money from customers of a Chinese loan application. A complainant claimed that the abuse and extortion had taken place despite the repayment of the loan. The customers would receive threatening calls and text messages as part of the abuse, the police said.

362.title: Hyd Police arrests 3 people, seize gutka & tobacco worth over ₹17,500
362.article_body: Hyderabad Police apprehended three people on Friday and seized gutka and tobacco worth ₹17,579 from their possession. The accused, who had the materials in their possession in order to deliver them to customers at Mahadev Kirana & General Store, near Bowenpally check post, were nabbed by Bowenpally Police. They were caught based on a tip-off following a surprise check.

363.title: I like watching Rohit Sharma, he has aggressive nature: Odean
363.article_body: West Indies all-rounder Odean Smith has said that Rohit Sharma is the Indian player he admires the most. "Rohit is one of those players with (amazing) batting speed. He has a very aggressive nature and I would like to take that (aspect of his batting) in my game also," he stated. Odean further said, "I like watching him."

364.title: No penalty for not wearing face masks inside Delhi Metro
364.article_body: The Delhi Metro Rail Corporation (DMRC) on Sunday said no penalty will be imposed on passengers who are not wearing face masks while travelling in metro. "As per Delhi Disaster Management Authority guidelines, it is advised to follow COVID-19 appropriate behaviour like wearing of mask, hand sanitisation, etc," DMRC said in response to a query by a Twitter user.

365.title: Not keen on becoming UPA chief or leading anti-BJP front: Pawar
365.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said on Sunday that he isn't keen on becoming United Progressive Alliance's (UPA) chairperson or leading anti-BJP front. Pawar, however, stated that he's supportive of the formation of such an alliance, adding that Congress should be included in it. Pawar's comments came after NCP's youth wing proposed his name for UPA chief's post.

366.title: New scheme plans to set up 'Hobby Hubs' in Delhi govt schools
366.article_body: The Directorate of Education (DoE) in Delhi plans to set up 'Hobby Hubs' in government schools for the 2022-2023 academic session, according to a report in The Indian Express. However, this project will only be implemented in single-shift government schools. The DoE will invite applications from interested academies to execute the project in schools, the report said.

367.title: Cyberabad Traffic Police educates students about road safety
367.article_body: The Cyberabad Traffic Police on Friday conducted a road safety awareness drive in the town of Chevella. As per the force's official Twitter handle, Chevella Traffic Inspector G Guruvayya educated students about traffic rules at the Chevella bus stop. A group of students was told about the dangers and penalties for minor driving, rash driving and driving without a licence.

368.title: PCMC's building permission dept collects record ₹1,036-cr revenue in 2021-22
368.article_body: The building permission department of the Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation generated a record ₹1,036 crore in revenue in the 2021-22 financial year. "The building permission department has never registered such a high collection in the past," Joint City Engineer Makrand Nikam said. Among other works, the department is responsible for issuing necessary permits for all kinds of buildings.

369.title: Mumbai man chats nude on dating app; blackmailed to pay ₹10,000
369.article_body: A 24-year-old from Mumbai's Andheri (East) was blackmailed to pay ₹10,000 via GPay after he chatted nude with a woman he met on a dating app. The victim joined a video call with the accused and removed his clothes upon seeing the girl nude. He later received a video saying it would be made viral if he doesn't pay ₹10,000.

370.title: Time running out, people must be protected: Sangakkara on Sri Lanka crisis
370.article_body: Former Sri Lankan cricketer Kumar Sangakkara took to Facebook to share his thoughts on the Sri Lankan economic crisis and emergency. "Sri Lankans are going through one of the toughest times imaginable," he wrote. "The people aren't the enemy, Sri Lanka is its people...Time is fast running out...the people and their future must be protected and provided for," he added.

371.title: Delhi Police arrests 110, recover 220 gms of ganja in last 24 hrs
371.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 110 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 220 grams of ganja in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 12 proclaimed offenders, seized 392 litres of illicit liquor and recovered 12 stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,685 calls, the post added.

372.title: 17-yr-old kills father in Pune, hangs body to pass off as suicide
372.article_body: Pune Police on Saturday detained a 17-year-old boy for allegedly throttling his father to death and hanging his body on an iron pole outside their house to pass it off as a case of suicide. The boy allegedly killed his father because he suspected his mother's character and harassed her over this issue, the report said.

373.title: IFS officer posts pic of 'meditating owl', says 'it has the perfect camouflage'
373.article_body: Indian Forest Service (IFS) officer Susanta Nanda posted a picture of a 'meditating owl' on a tree and said, "[It] has the perfect camouflage that one can ever see." The picture quickly gained traction with many users trying to spot the camouflaged bird. "Even I had to meditate for a few seconds to make it visible," said one user.

374.title: Bharti Singh and Haarsh Limbachiyaa become parents, welcome a baby boy
374.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh and her producer-husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on Sunday took to social media to announce that they've become parents and welcomed a baby boy. The couple shared a picture of themselves that had "It's a boy" written on it. Earlier this week, Bharti Singh had refuted rumours that she had welcomed her first child, a baby girl.

375.title: MNS leader arrested for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers in Mumbai
375.article_body: MNS leader Mahendra Bhanushali was arrested on Sunday for playing Hanuman Chalisa on loudspeakers without permission in Mumbai. "They have taken away my amplifier. But I would like to say, in coming times, 'Jai Shree Ram' will be played on loudspeakers," Bhanushali said following his arrest. Earlier, Hanuman Chalisa was played on loudspeakers at Maharashtra Navnirman Sena office in Ghatkopar.

376.title: Raj govt failed to maintain law & order: Shekhawat on Karauli clashes
376.article_body: Reacting to communal clashes in Rajasthan's Karauli on Saturday, Union Minister Gajendra Singh Shekhawat said that state government has failed to maintain law and order. "If people are being attacked...for celebrating...Indian New Year in India...it's a matter of concern," he added. At least 25 people were left injured after clashes broke out following stone-pelting at a bike rally in Karauli.

377.title: Russian forces preventing Ukrainian resupply by Black Sea: UK
377.article_body: UK Military Intelligence on Sunday said Russia naval forces continue to blockade the Ukrainian coast on the Black Sea and Sea of Azov, preventing resupply by sea. As per the update, Russian forces retain the ability to launch an amphibious landing. However, it said  mines within the Black Sea pose a serious risk to maritime activity.

378.title: I'm greedy actor, want to tell stories irrespective of medium: Vidya
378.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has called herself a greedy actor, saying that she just wants to tell stories and connect to people irrespective of any medium. She further said that she doesn't have any method to choose a script and picks them instinctively. "We are in a day and age where some films will work and some won't," the actress added.

379.title: BTS' Jungkook recovers from COVID-19, to perform at Grammys
379.article_body: South Korean boy band BTS member Jungkook has recovered from COVID-19 and will be performing at the 2022 Grammys ceremony in US' Las Vegas, his management agency announced on Sunday. The singer had tested negative for COVID-19 before departing from South Korea but tested positive after landing in US. Jungkook has been under quarantine since March 27.

380.title: You need confidence after losing 1st match: Babar on ODI series win vs Aus
380.article_body: Pakistan skipper Babar Azam has credited his players for the 2-1 ODI series win against Australia. "You need confidence after losing the first game. Credit goes to the players as they took responsibility and showed good efforts," Azam said. He adds, "When you get early wickets, there is pressure on the opposition. Almost every bowler of ours executed their plans."

381.title: Ozone may be weakening one of Earth's vital cooling mechanisms: Study
381.article_body: A group of international researchers warned ozone may be weakening one of Earth's most important cooling mechanisms. The study revealed that ozone levels in upper and lower atmosphere were responsible for almost a third of the warming in the Southern Ocean. Team used models to simulate changes in ozone levels in the upper and lower atmosphere between 1955 and 2000.

382.title: Poland would like a 50% increase in US troops in Europe: Deputy PM
382.article_body: Polish Deputy PM Jaroslaw Kaczynski on Sunday said Poland would be pleased if US increased its number of troops by 50% in Europe. "Of these, 75,000 soldiers should be stationed on the eastern flank, 50,000 soldiers in the Baltic states, Poland," the leader of the ruling party added. Reportedly, 80,000 US troops were stationed in Europe before Russians entered Ukraine.

383.title: Our team sets out to win events like World Cup: Alyssa Healy
383.article_body: After winning their seventh Women's World Cup, Australian wicketkeeper-batter Alyssa Healy said that her team "sets out to win events like these (World Cup)". "Everyone is sort of keen to get out there and do just that," Healy said. She also said that she "never imagined in her wildest dreams" of scoring 170 in the World Cup final against England.

384.title: UN Human Rights Council names Tuvalu negotiator as climate expert
384.article_body: UN Human Rights Council on Friday appointed Tuvalu negotiator Ian Fry an expert on climate change and human rights for first time on Friday. The new independent expert is required to study and identify how the adverse effects of climate change affect the full and effective enjoyment of human rights. Fry has been appointed for a period of three years.

385.title: Fire breaks out at Kanpur's Rave Moti Mall, no injury reported
385.article_body: A fire broke out at Kanpur's Rave Moti Mall, where a huge number of people had come, on Sunday. No injury was reported so far, Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police (West) Brijesh Srivastava said, adding six fire tenders were on spot. The fire on first floor was under control and efforts were underway to douse the flames on second floor.

386.title: India's exports touch record high of $417.8 bn in FY22, govt calls it 'historic'
386.article_body: Union Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal on Sunday announced that India's exports touched a record high of $417.8 billion in FY22, and called the milestone "historic". "It's the first time that the country's yearly exports have reached this figure and the exports were 5% above the set target," Goyal said. Goods worth $40 billion were exported in March 2022 alone.

387.title: You don't know which Punjab will turn up: Parthiv ahead of PBKS vs CSK
387.article_body: Ahead of PBKS-CSK in IPL 2022, ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel said PBKS are playing the same way despite having overhauled the set-up. "You don't know which Punjab will turn up- the 200-run...or 120-run Punjab because such is the style of play," he added. PBKS have played two matches so far, winning and losing one each. Match will be played today.

388.title: Congratulations for yet another WC: Jaffer after Aus Women's 7th title
388.article_body: Following Australia's record-extending seventh Women's World Cup title in Christchurch, Wasim Jaffer took to Twitter and wrote, "Congratulations to Australia Women for winning yet another World Cup...commiserations to England." Australia Test captain Pat Cummins tweeted, "Congratulations to Meg [Lanning], Motty [Matthew Mott] and the team. Huge. What a win and tournament, enjoy accordingly."

389.title: Mumbai Police band plays 'Happy B'day' for kid amid 'Sunday Streets'
389.article_body: A team from Khaki Studio, the Mumbai Police's band, which was present during the 'Sunday Streets' event in the city, was seen playing the 'Happy Birthday' tune for a child celebrating his birthday amid the gathering. In a video uploaded on Instagram, the child can be seen cutting his birthday cake while the tune is played by the band.

390.title: I am exhausted: Singer Camila on being stalked by photographers for bikini pics
390.article_body: Singer Camila Cabello took to Instagram to share a post on her body image struggles and how photographers stalk her to get her bikini pictures when she goes to the beach. Adding that she is exhausted, Camila said that photographers even hide in the bushes sometimes to get pictures. She further said it has impacted her self esteem.

391.title: People not having kids in the first place is a problem: Elon Musk
391.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk, who has raised concerns about the falling birth rate in the past, on Sunday tweeted, "Humanity did not evolve to mourn the unborn...But we should...I'm talking about not having kids in the first place. That's the problem." He also responded to a picture of Nikola Tesla by tweeting, "He never had even one kid."

392.title: Russian troops selling items looted from Ukraine in Belarus: Ukraine ministry
392.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Ministry has shared a social media post on how Russian troops have opened a market in Belarus to sell goods stolen from houses in Ukraine during the invasion. The ministry said they have been selling washing machines, children's toys, cosmetics, cars, dishes and jewellery, among other things. They are also trying to exchange looted currency, it added.

393.title: Over 600 arrested in Sri Lanka's Western Province for violating curfew
393.article_body: Sri Lanka on Sunday arrested 664 protesters in the country's Western Province for violating a 36-hour-long curfew that has been imposed amid the country's ongoing economic crisis. The arrests were made ahead of planned 'Arab Spring' style protests across country, which were held later today. Sri Lanka is grappling with a shortage of essential items and rolling power cuts.

394.title: Would've been nice had I stayed to finish the game vs RR: MI's Tilak
394.article_body: Mumbai Indians batter Tilak Varma, reacting to his knock against Rajasthan Royals, said, "I'm very happy to know...I have become the youngest MI player to score a fifty." Despite Tilak's 33-ball 61 runs, Rajasthan defeated Mumbai by 23 runs. "It would've been nice had I stayed to finish the game. I'll try to do so in upcoming matches," he added.

395.title: India beat England 3-2 on penalties in FIH Pro League game
395.article_body: India defeated England 3-2 in penalty shoot-out after the English team scored an equaliser with just 12 seconds remaining in the FIH Men's Hockey Pro League match in Bhubaneswar on Saturday. Both teams finished at 3-3 leading to the shoot-outs which India won in their seventh shoot-out attempt. Defender Harmanpreet Singh was adjudged as the 'Player of the Match'.

396.title: I'm mature player now: Imam-Ul-Haq after ODI series win vs Australia
396.article_body: After scoring unbeaten 89 runs in a nine-wicket win over Australia in the third ODI, Pakistan batter Imam-Ul-Haq said, "I'm a mature player now. Working hard from last one and a half years." Talking about winning the ODI series, he said, "The way boys came back from the first match comes down to the self-belief...trust we have in each other."

397.title: BMC to set up solar-powered poles in Mumbai to save electricity
397.article_body: BMC will set up solar power electric poles resembling trees in Mumbai as part of its tactical urbanism plan. Each pole will have five high-power LED lights and "will be able to save up to 35% of daily consumption of regular electricity", according to officials. "The primary objective is...to spread awareness about...clean and renewable energy," the project in-charge said.

398.title: Praggnanandhaa can become future world champion: Viswanathan Anand
398.article_body: Five-time world champion Viswanathan Anand said he feels that 16-year-old chess Grandmaster Rameshbabu Praggnanandhaa can become a "world champion" in the future. "It's a big deal to beat... Magnus Carlsen. Praggnanandhaa has done it, so he has got talent," Anand said. "I am working with some young talents including Praggnanandhaa...All have the potential...[to] become World Champions," he added.

399.title: RS played crucial role in strengthening parliamentary democracy: Naidu
399.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu on Sunday said that the Rajya Sabha has played a "crucial role in strengthening parliamentary democracy". "I would like to appeal to the members of Rajya Sabha to engage in informed and constructive debates by keeping the welfare of the people in mind," the Vice President said.

400.title: Argument over WhatsApp chat claims man's life in Kerala
400.article_body: An argument while chatting on WhatsApp led to a 42-year-old man getting killed in Kerala’s Pathanamthitta district on Saturday. According to the police, the deceased, Ranjith, was a newspaper agent who got into a scuffle with his neighbour Anil (43) on March 27 over a WhatsApp conversation. During the brawl, Ranjith suffered a fatal head injury, police said.

401.title: Video shows rescue of woman smuggled in duffel bag from a burning car in US
401.article_body: A video has been shared by the police in the US which captured the moment when a woman, who was stuffed in a duffel bag, was rescued from a burning car. While the bodycam footage captured how the woman was rescued, it's believed that she was being smuggled by a man who crashed the car, resulting in it catching fire.

402.title: Can't please everybody, not an avocado: Malaika on fashion choices
402.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora, on being asked about her fashion choices, said that she can't please everybody, adding that she is not an avocado. "When I was younger I was far more experimental and some of those experiments turned out terrible," she added. The actress gave the interview hours before getting hospitalised following a car accident on Saturday.
